Title: Business Systems Analyst
Description:
At ExtraHop, we're on a mission to help organizations achieve complete visibility, real-time threat detection, and proactive security through cutting-edge network detection and response (NDR) technology. Our NDR product is a market leader, providing our customers with the ability to detect, investigate, and respond to threats faster than ever before.

We’re proud of the work we do and the recognition we’ve received, including our recent Gartner Peer Insights award, which reflects the trust and satisfaction our customers have in our solutions.

If you're passionate about innovation, dedicated to protecting digital infrastructures, and ready to make a real impact, we invite you to join our team and help us shape the future of cybersecurity.

As a Business Systems Analyst on the ExtraHop IT Applications team, you’ll leverage a full spectrum of business applications, including Salesforce, to design and implement solutions for our entire organization. You will partner with teams across the company and your work will have a direct impact on the outcomes of our business.

Duties And Responsibilities


Engage with stakeholders to perform detailed analysis of business and technical requirements, and translate them into solutions.
Manage and maintain a portfolio of SaaS applications and recommend new technology when needed to meet business goals.
Partner with developers and admins to design, build, test, deploy, and document solutions using standard functionality and custom development.
Support our internal customers by triaging and working tickets related to supported business applications.
Stay current with the periodic feature release announcements of supported applications and leverage any new capabilities as applicable.
Be part of an agile scrum team and participate in planning, documentation, execution, testing, and launch of projects.
Develop and maintain comprehensive project documentation, including business process models, use cases, and test plans.


Basic Qualifications


Bachelor’s degree in Business Administration, Computer Science, or equivalent experience.
2+ years of experience in an analyst role (Business Systems Analyst, Sales Analyst, etc.)
Self-directed learning, problem solving, and researching of system issues.
Strong business analysis and functional experience, including requirements gathering, creating/deploying solutions to end users.
Previous experience in systems integration.
Strong technical knowledge of Salesforce data structure; understanding of how to leverage Salesforce functionality to meet complex process and reporting requirements.
Detail-oriented with strong data management skills including experience using Excel and Data Loader.
Understanding of Salesforce CPQ and its processes
Partner Community experience a Plus (Salesforce, Allbound)
Experience with Sales processes (pipeline management, territory management, forecasting)


Preferred Qualifications


Salesforce Administrator or Platform App Builder Certification
2+ years experience as a Salesforce Administrator
Familiarity with agile software delivery methodologies and working as part of an agile team


$80,770 - $101,000 + benefits

Applicants must be authorized to work for ANY employer in the U.S. We are unable to sponsor or assume sponsorship of an employment Visa at this time.

About Extrahop

ExtraHop is the cybersecurity partner enterprises trust to reveal the unknown and unmask the attack. We’re on a mission to protect and propagate trust by revealing the cybertruth, and we partner with every customer, every day, to uncover it. Our Reveal(x) 360 platform is the only network detection and response solution delivering the 360-degree visibility needed to see everything on the network. When organizations have full network transparency with ExtraHop, they can see more, know more, and stop more cyberattacks.

ExtraHop is recognized by leading organizations for both its innovation in the market and its commitment to building a world-class team. We’ve been recognized as a “Customer’s Choice” by Gartner Peer Insights™ Voice of the Customer, and as a Leader in the Forrester Wave®: Network Analysis and Visibility, Q2 2023. ExtraHop has won AI Breakthrough Awards four times (2018-2020, 2023) and our Channel Partner program has received a 5-star rating from CRN for our 2023 Partner Program Guide. Our flagship product, Reveal(x), has received numerous accolades, including a 2022 Edison Award for Cybersecurity.

Benefits

Employees' wellbeing is top of mind for the ExtraHop team. Employees and their families will have the option to participate in the following benefits:


Health, Dental, and Vision Benefits
Flexible PTO, Sick Time Prorated Based on Date of Hire, and All Federal Holidays (US Only) + 3 Days of Paid Volunteer Time
Non-Commissioned Positions may be eligible to participate in the Annual Discretionary Bonus Plan
FSA and Dependent Care Accounts + EAP, where applicable
Educational Reimbursement
401k with Employer Match or Pension where applicable
Pet Insurance (US Only)
Parental Leave (US Only)
Hybrid and Remote Work Model

HTML:
At ExtraHop, we're on a mission to help organizations achieve complete visibility, real-time threat detection, and proactive security through cutting-edge network detection and response (NDR) technology. Our NDR product is a market leader, providing our customers with the ability to detect, investigate, and respond to threats faster than ever before.

We’re proud of the work we do and the recognition we’ve received, including our recent Gartner Peer Insights award, which reflects the trust and satisfaction our customers have in our solutions.

If you're passionate about innovation, dedicated to protecting digital infrastructures, and ready to make a real impact, we invite you to join our team and help us shape the future of cybersecurity.

As a Business Systems Analyst on the ExtraHop IT Applications team, you’ll leverage a full spectrum of business applications, including Salesforce, to design and implement solutions for our entire organization. You will partner with teams across the company and your work will have a direct impact on the outcomes of our business.

Duties And Responsibilities

  • Engage with stakeholders to perform detailed analysis of business and technical requirements, and translate them into solutions.
  • Manage and maintain a portfolio of SaaS applications and recommend new technology when needed to meet business goals.
  • Partner with developers and admins to design, build, test, deploy, and document solutions using standard functionality and custom development.
  • Support our internal customers by triaging and working tickets related to supported business applications.
  • Stay current with the periodic feature release announcements of supported applications and leverage any new capabilities as applicable.
  • Be part of an agile scrum team and participate in planning, documentation, execution, testing, and launch of projects.
  • Develop and maintain comprehensive project documentation, including business process models, use cases, and test plans.

Basic Qualifications

  • Bachelor’s degree in Business Administration, Computer Science, or equivalent experience.
  • 2+ years of experience in an analyst role (Business Systems Analyst, Sales Analyst, etc.)
  • Self-directed learning, problem solving, and researching of system issues.
  • Strong business analysis and functional experience, including requirements gathering, creating/deploying solutions to end users.
  • Previous experience in systems integration.
  • Strong technical knowledge of Salesforce data structure; understanding of how to leverage Salesforce functionality to meet complex process and reporting requirements.
  • Detail-oriented with strong data management skills including experience using Excel and Data Loader.
  • Understanding of Salesforce CPQ and its processes
  • Partner Community experience a Plus (Salesforce, Allbound)
  • Experience with Sales processes (pipeline management, territory management, forecasting)

Preferred Qualifications

  • Salesforce Administrator or Platform App Builder Certification
  • 2+ years experience as a Salesforce Administrator
  • Familiarity with agile software delivery methodologies and working as part of an agile team

$80,770 - $101,000 + benefits

Applicants must be authorized to work for ANY employer in the U.S. We are unable to sponsor or assume sponsorship of an employment Visa at this time.

About Extrahop

ExtraHop is the cybersecurity partner enterprises trust to reveal the unknown and unmask the attack. We’re on a mission to protect and propagate trust by revealing the cybertruth, and we partner with every customer, every day, to uncover it. Our Reveal(x) 360 platform is the only network detection and response solution delivering the 360-degree visibility needed to see everything on the network. When organizations have full network transparency with ExtraHop, they can see more, know more, and stop more cyberattacks.

ExtraHop is recognized by leading organizations for both its innovation in the market and its commitment to building a world-class team. We’ve been recognized as a “Customer’s Choice” by Gartner Peer Insights™ Voice of the Customer, and as a Leader in the Forrester Wave®: Network Analysis and Visibility, Q2 2023. ExtraHop has won AI Breakthrough Awards four times (2018-2020, 2023) and our Channel Partner program has received a 5-star rating from CRN for our 2023 Partner Program Guide. Our flagship product, Reveal(x), has received numerous accolades, including a 2022 Edison Award for Cybersecurity.

  • Health, Dental, and Vision Benefits
  • Flexible PTO, Sick Time Prorated Based on Date of Hire, and All Federal Holidays (US Only) + 3 Days of Paid Volunteer Time

  • 401k with Employer Match or Pension where applicable

Title: Data Engineer, Amazon Fresh Grocery, Amazon
Description:
Description

Amazon Fresh Grocery is seeking a talented and entrepreneurial Data Engineer who is passionate about innovation and data democratization. Your mission is to dramatically scale the speed and quality of decision-making in our Retail operations through a mesh of interoperable domain-oriented data products, self-serve data platform, intelligent automation, and scientific applications.

As the lead Data Engineer for the Central Retail BI team, you will be a strategic partner for fellow engineers, analysts, scientists, and business leads to solve the most complex data problems in the Grocery business. You will work with a wide range of tools and systems and stay abreast of emergent technologies and frameworks, knowing where and when to implement them. You will have strong data mining and modeling skills and be comfortable facilitating Think Big ideation, working from concept through to execution. You will partner with Central Data Engineering team on solutions, federated governance, and overall data architecture and strategy. You will participate in the full development life cycle including design, implementation and testing, documentation, delivery, support, and maintenance.

Key job responsibilities


Design, implement and support a self-serve data platform for engineers, scientists, and business stakehodlers (for both technical and non-technical user groups)
Build and maintain interoperable AWS components for data storage, computation, and compliance/privacy (e.g., EC2, EMR, S3, Glue, Redshift, etc.)
Develop the end-to-end automation of data pipelines, making datasets readily-consumable by visualization tools and notification systems
Create automated alarming and dashboards to monitor data integrity
Interface with other technology teams to extract, transform, and load data from a wide variety of data sources using SQL, scripting (e.g., Python), and AWS technologies
Influence the organization to adopt next-generation data technology and frameworks, knowing where and when to implement
Partner with fellow engineers and scientists to build proof of concept applications (iterating and improving upon them over time) such as for business process automation, forecasting, and causal inference
Produce and maintain comprehensive documentation and metadata for your solutions


Basic Qualifications


Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Engineering, Mathematics, or a related technical discipline
3+ years of industry experience in Data Engineering, Software Development, Business Intelligence, Data Science, or related field with a track record of manipulating, processing, and extracting value from large datasets.
Highly proficient in writing complex, highly-optimized SQL to build ETL pipelines
Highly proficient in at least one scripting language (e.g., Python, R, Bash)
Strong knowledge of data modeling, data warehousing, and distributed storage and computing.
Proven success in communicating with users, other technical teams, and senior management to collect requirements, describe data modeling decisions and data engineering strategy
Familiarity with business intelligence reporting tools such as Tableau, QuickSight, or Cognos


Preferred Qualifications


Master’s degree in Computer Science, Engineering, Mathematics, or a related technical discipline
Experience working with AWS big data technologies (e.g., EMR, Redshift, S3, Glue, Kinesis and Lambda)
Knowledge of software engineering best practices across the development lifecycle, including agile methodologies, coding standards, code reviews, source management, build processes, testing, and operations
Experience providing technical coaching and mentoring to other engineers for best practices on data engineering
Familiarity with statistical models and auto-detection algorithms for solving data quality
Prior experience in Retail, Consumables, and/or Supply Chain Management industry


Amazon is committed to a diverse and inclusive workplace. Amazon is an equal opportunity employer and does not discriminate on the basis of race, national origin, gender, gender identity, sexual orientation, protected veteran status, disability, age, or other legally protected status. For individuals with disabilities who would like to request an accommodation, please visit https://www.amazon.jobs/en/disability/us.

Our compensation reflects the cost of labor across several US geographic markets. The base pay for this position ranges from $118,900/year in our lowest geographic market up to $205,600/year in our highest geographic market. Pay is based on a number of factors including market location and may vary depending on job-related knowledge, skills, and experience. Amazon is a total compensation company. Dependent on the position offered, equity, sign-on payments, and other forms of compensation may be provided as part of a total compensation package, in addition to a full range of medical, financial, and/or other benefits. For more information, please visit https://www.aboutamazon.com/workplace/employee-benefits. This position will remain posted until filled. Applicants should apply via our internal or external career site.

Company - Amazon.com Services LLC

Job ID: A2750129

Title: Data Engineer
Description:
Description

Amazon seeks an experienced Data Engineer to join the DPS (Deny Party Screening) team. Our mission is to prevent denied parties from transacting with Amazon businesses, including AWS, customers, vendors, sellers, subsidiaries, etc. We screen billions of events every day. We integrate with Tier 1 systems, build DPS systems, and deal with unique scaling challenges.

As a Data Engineer, you will design, implement and support scalable data infrastructure solutions to integrate with multi heterogeneous data sources, aggregate and retrieve data in a fast and safe mode, curate data that can be used in reporting, analysis, machine learning models and ad-hoc data requests. You will be exposed to cutting edge AWS big data technologies. You should have excellent business and communication skills to be able to work with business owners and Tech leaders to gather infrastructure requirements, design data infrastructure, build up data pipelines and datasets to meet business needs. You stay abreast of emerging technologies, investigating and implementing where appropriate.

Key job responsibilities


Design, implement, and support data warehouse/ data lake infrastructure using AWS bigdata stack, Python, Redshift, QuickSight, Glue/lake formation, EMR/Spark, Athena etc.
Develop and manage ETLs to source data from various financial, AWS networking and operational systems and create unified data model for analytics and reporting.
Creation and support of real-time data pipelines built on AWS technologies including EMR, Glue, Redshift/Spectrum and Athena.
Collaborate with other Engineering teams, Product/Finance Managers/Analysts to implement advanced analytics algorithms that exploit our rich datasets for financial model development, statistical analysis, prediction, etc.
Continual research of the latest big data and visualization technologies to provide new capabilities and increase efficiency.
Use business intelligence and visualization software (e.g., QuickSight) to develop dashboards those are used by senior leadership.
Empower technical and non-technical, internal customers to drive their own analytics and reporting (self-serve reporting) and support ad-hoc reporting when needed.
Working closely with team members to drive real-time model implementations for monitoring and alerting of risk systems.
Manage numerous requests concurrently and strategically, prioritizing when necessary
Partner/collaborate across teams/roles to deliver results.
Mentor other engineers, influence positively team culture, and help grow the team


About The Team

Denied Party Screening (DPS) is a part of Amazon Security, an organization designed to drive bar-raising security engagements. The vision of the Amazon DPS program is to ensure that 1+ billion Amazon accounts spanning across consumers, sellers, developers, employees, and all other Amazon party, are not a denied party, located or incorporated in a sanctioned region or country, or owned or controlled by or subject to the jurisdiction of the government of a sanctioned country.

Why Amazon Security

At Amazon, security is central to maintaining customer trust and delivering delightful customer experiences. Our organization is responsible for creating and maintaining a high bar for security across all of Amazon’s products and services.

Work/Life Balance

We value work-life harmony. Achieving success at work should never come at the expense of sacrifices at home, which is why flexible work hours and arrangements are part of our culture. When we feel supported in the workplace and at home, there’s nothing we can’t achieve.

Inclusive Team Culture

In Amazon Security, it’s in our nature to learn and be curious. Ongoing DEI events and learning experiences inspire us to continue learning and to embrace our uniqueness. Addressing the toughest security challenges requires that we seek out and celebrate a diversity of ideas, perspectives, and voices.

Training and Career growth

We’re continuously raising our performance bar as we strive to become Earth’s Best Employer. That’s why you’ll find endless knowledge-sharing, training, and other career-advancing resources here to help you develop into a better-rounded professional.

Basic Qualifications


5+ years of data engineering experience
Experience programming with at least one modern language such as C++, C#, Java, Python, Golang, PowerShell, Ruby
Experience working on and delivering end to end projects independently
Experience with big data technologies such as: Hadoop, Hive, Spark, EMR


Preferred Qualifications


Experience with AWS technologies like Redshift, S3, AWS Glue, EMR, Kinesis, FireHose, Lambda, and IAM roles and permissions
Experience with non-relational databases / data stores (object storage, document or key-value stores, graph databases, column-family databases)
Experience in at least one modern scripting or programming language, such as Python, Java, Scala, or NodeJS
Experience with distributed systems as it pertains to data storage and computing
Experience as a data engineer or related specialty (e.g., software engineer, business intelligence engineer, data scientist) with a track record of manipulating, processing, and extracting value from large datasets
Experience providing technical leadership and mentoring other engineers for best practices on data engineering


Amazon is committed to a diverse and inclusive workplace. Amazon is an equal opportunity employer and does not discriminate on the basis of race, national origin, gender, gender identity, sexual orientation, protected veteran status, disability, age, or other legally protected status. For individuals with disabilities who would like to request an accommodation, please visit https://www.amazon.jobs/en/disability/us.

Our compensation reflects the cost of labor across several US geographic markets. The base pay for this position ranges from $118,900/year in our lowest geographic market up to $205,600/year in our highest geographic market. Pay is based on a number of factors including market location and may vary depending on job-related knowledge, skills, and experience. Amazon is a total compensation company. Dependent on the position offered, equity, sign-on payments, and other forms of compensation may be provided as part of a total compensation package, in addition to a full range of medical, financial, and/or other benefits. For more information, please visit https://www.aboutamazon.com/workplace/employee-benefits. This position will remain posted until filled. Applicants should apply via our internal or external career site.

Company - Amazon.com Services LLC

Job ID: A2732695

Title: Data Visualization Analyst
Description:
We offer:




Join a best-in-class team that brings ideas, innovation and passion
Work directly with senior management from various business units
The ability to grow and shape your own career
Collaborative creative environment
Working on real business problems
Contingent/Leased assignment working onsite at Morgan Stanley
Contract via 3rd party agency




You will:




Partner extensively with other teams and business partners within and outside the department (such as sales, marketing, product owners, data science and data modelling) to deliver business solutions and support decision making
Develop Tableau dashboards and data visualizations for reporting to senior management and business users including Financial Advisors
Provide analytics and insight for various business initiatives and projects
Utilize proactive problem-solving and innovative thinking to address challenges
Build, monitor and review data models and conduct analyses based on specific requirements

Establish strong work relationships with team members across Wealth Management functions to support strategic initiatives




You have:




0-3 years of business analytics experience or experience with digital tools
Highly motivated, detail-oriented self-starter personality with a strong sense of ownership, willingness to learn, high degree of curiosity and desire to succeed
Advanced written and verbal communications in English
Strong analytical mindset
Strong sense of identifying priorities
The ability to handle multiple tasks and projects concurrently
Strong problem-solving skills with the ability to determine business partner needs and create purpose built solutions
The ability to work collaboratively across multiple business units, teams job functions and geographical locations
At least Bachelor’s Degree




You preferably have:

Data visualization experience (Tableau, QlikView etc)
Experience with SQL, DataIku




Department Profile:




The Analytics & Data (A&D) organization is a key growth area within Morgan Stanley’s Wealth Management Division, playing a critical role in the execution of the wider Wealth Management strategy. The use of analytics and data will be a key driver in accelerating growth across all client segments, enabling data-driven decision making and delivering the best client experience.




About us:




Morgan Stanley provides a superior foundation for building a professional career - a place for people to learn, achieve and grow. You will be exposed to a truly international and multi-cultural environment that appreciates and respects individuality.

Interested in flexible working opportunities? Morgan Stanley empowers employees to have greater freedom of choice through flexible working arrangements. Speak to our recruitment team to find out more.

Morgan Stanley is an equal opportunities employer. We work to provide a supportive and inclusive environment where all individuals can maximise their full potential. Our skilled and creative workforce is comprised of individuals drawn from a broad cross section of the global communities in which we operate and who reflect a variety of backgrounds, talents, perspectives and experiences. Our strong commitment to a culture of inclusion is evident through our constant focus on recruiting, developing and advancing individuals based on their skills and talents.

Our strong commitment to a culture of inclusion is evident through our constant focus on recruiting, developing and advancing individuals based on their skills and talents.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
We offer:




• Join a best-in-class team that brings ideas, innovation and passion

• Work directly with senior management from various business units

• The ability to grow and shape your own career

• Collaborative creative environment

• Working on real business problems

• Contingent/Leased assignment working onsite at Morgan Stanley

• Contract via 3rd party agency




You will:




• Create, implement, and manage survey initiatives with primary focus on programming surveys, data collection and synthetization

• Design surveys for distribution to clients, prospects, employees and vendors

• Build data visualizations for reporting to senior management and the survey requesting business units

• Create data queries to generate survey distribution lists that capture statistically significant responses

• Pair survey results with internal data for studies and reporting

• Participate in governance and monitoring of execution of strategic surveys across Morgan Stanley Wealth Management

• Establish strong work relationships with team members across Wealth Management functions to support strategic initiatives

• Assist in the development of Tableau dashboards and data visualizations for reporting to senior management and business users including Financial Advisors

• Provide analytics and insight for various business initiatives and projects

• Utilize proactive problem-solving and innovative thinking to address challenges




You have:




• 0-3 years of business analytics experience or experience with digital tools

• Highly motivated, detail-oriented self-starter personality with a strong sense of ownership, willingness to learn, high degree of curiosity and desire to succeed

• Advanced written and verbal communications in English

• Strong analytical mindset

• Strong sense of identifying priorities

• The ability to handle multiple tasks and projects concurrently

• Strong problem-solving skills with the ability to determine business partner needs and create purpose built solutions

• The ability to work collaboratively across multiple business units, teams job functions and geographical locations

• At least Bachelor’s Degree




You preferably have:




• Knowledge / Experience in Marketing / Market Research and Analysis

• Hands on experience utilizing digital tools, survey platforms (Qualtrics, Medallia, Confirmit, Adobe Analytics, Power BI, Google Analytics, etc.)

You might also have:

• Data visualization experience (Tableau, QlikView etc)

• Experience with SPSS, R, SQL, DataIku




Department Profile:




The Analytics & Data (A&D) organization is a key growth area within Morgan Stanley’s Wealth Management Division, playing a critical role in the execution of the wider Wealth Management strategy. The use of analytics and data will be a key driver in accelerating growth across all client segments, enabling data-driven decision making and delivering the best client experience.




About us:




Morgan Stanley provides a superior foundation for building a professional career - a place for people to learn, achieve and grow. You will be exposed to a truly international and multi-cultural environment that appreciates and respects individuality.

Interested in flexible working opportunities? Morgan Stanley empowers employees to have greater freedom of choice through flexible working arrangements. Speak to our recruitment team to find out more.

Morgan Stanley is an equal opportunities employer. We work to provide a supportive and inclusive environment where all individuals can maximise their full potential. Our skilled and creative workforce is comprised of individuals drawn from a broad cross section of the global communities in which we operate and who reflect a variety of backgrounds, talents, perspectives and experiences. Our strong commitment to a culture of inclusion is evident through our constant focus on recruiting, developing and advancing individuals based on their skills and talents.

Title: Data Analyst
Place: Pozuelo de Alarcón, Community of Madrid, Spain
Description:
Grenergy es un productor independiente de energía (IPP) que integra el desarrollo, construcción, operación y mantenimiento de plantas de energía renovable a gran escala. La compañía incorpora además sus propios equipos dedicados a la originación de PPAs, financiación estructurada y M&A, generando eficiencias como consecuencia de la integración de todo el proceso.




A finales de 2019, dimos el salto a Mercado Continuo (Bolsa de Madrid), consolidando nuestro crecimiento y permitiéndonos continuar con nuestro ambicioso plan de expansión internacional. En la actualidad, contamos con presencia en 12 países: España (HQ), Chile, Colombia, Perú, México, Argentina, Italia, Alemania, Reino Unido, Polonia, Rumanía y Estados Unidos.




Grenergy ya cuenta con cerca de 1GW de proyectos en operación y construcción, y con un pipeline de 10GW de proyectos solares y eólicos en distintas etapas de desarrollo. Además, en 2021, la compañía ha invertido recursos para avanzar en el desarrollo de un pipeline adicional de casi 5GWh de proyectos de almacenamiento.




Debido a este crecimiento y a la fuerte apuesta de Grenergy, actualmente buscamos incorporar a un/a Data Analyst en nuestro equipo de Asset Management:




Cómo será tu día a día:




Desarrollar y mantener procesos de extracción de datos desde diferentes fuentes externas mediante el uso de APIs. Asegurar la integración y la calidad de los datos extraídos.
Gestión de Bases de Datos: Diseñar, implementar y mantener bases de datos eficientes y seguras. Asegurar la integridad, consistencia y disponibilidad de los datos.
Mejora permanente en las herramientas de reporting, incorporando las buenas prácticas presentes en el mercado.
Control y reporte del desempeño técnico-económico de activos fotovoltaicos y eólicos de la Compañía.
Colaboración interdepartamental: Trabajar en estrecha colaboración con otros equipos
Técnicos y financieros para entender las necesidades de datos y proporcionar soluciones eficientes.




Requisitos de la posición:




Ingeniería informática, Industrial, ADE o similar.
Al menos 1 año de experiencia en un rol similar.
Deseable formación en Big Data y/o Data Science.
Deseable experiencia en el sector energético y/o productivo industrial.
Nivel de inglés B2.
Microsoft office avanzado: Excel, Power BI, Power Point.
Dominio de SQL o similar. Experiencia con herramientas y lenguajes de programación para la extracción y manipulación de datos (Python, Java, etc.).
Familiaridad con herramientas de integración y ETL.
Comprensión de principios de seguridad y privacidad de datos.
Herramientas de automatización de scripts (AirFlow, PowerAutomate, etc).
Conocimientos en cloud (Azure) y arquitectura.
Buenas habilidades comunicacionales, proactividad y trabajo en equipo.
Motivación y pasión por el desarrollo de las energías renovables.




Ofrecemos gran desarrollo profesional y estabilidad en un sector en auge, en una empresa cotizada en pleno crecimiento y expansión internacional, así como buen ambiente en un equipo joven y dinámico.




Grenergy se compromete a ofrecer igualdad de oportunidades laborales, sin discriminación, a todos los empleados y candidatos sin distinción de raza, sexo, edad, ascendencia, color, religión, discapacidad, estado civil, origen, identidad de género, orientación sexual o cualquier otra característica.

Show more

Title: Junior Data Analyst
Description:
Company Description

Experian is a global data and technology company, powering opportunities for people and businesses around the world. We help to redefine lending practices, uncover and prevent fraud, simplify healthcare, create digital marketing solutions, and gain deeper insights into the automotive market, all using our unique combination of data, analytics and software. We also assist millions of people to realise their financial goals and help them to save time and money.

We operate across a range of markets, from financial services to healthcare, automotive, agribusiness, insurance, and many more industry segments.

We invest in people and new advanced technologies to unlock the power of data. As a FTSE 100 Index company listed on the London Stock Exchange (EXPN), we have a team of 22,500 people across 32 countries. Our corporate headquarters are in Dublin, Ireland.

Job Description

We are recruiting for our Marketing Analytics team. The Junior Data Analyst position is an important role within the department, reporting into the Targeting Analytics Manager.

What you'll be doing?

You will deliver analytical projects; this will involve analysing data sets, getting to the bottom of what is going on with the data and communicating your findings to different stakeholders within Experian.

Working with your team, you will blend a knowledge of mathematical, analytical or spatial techniques with a natural curiosity for understanding and analysing data.

Qualifications

What you'll bring?

Skills

We're after a team player who has a desire to deliver analysis projects to budgeted time, with accuracy, using core analytical techniques and applications. Desire and determination to develop your skills. Therefore, you'll bring:


Mathematical competency;
Geospatial/GIS expertise;
Data analysis and interpretation.


The following additional skills would be advantageous but not essential:


Regression Modelling;
Segmentation;
Machine Learning;
Location analysis.


It Would Be Great If You Have Previous Experience Of Data Analysis And Interpretation And An Understanding Of Any Programming Languages And Applications Such As


R;
Python;
SAS;
Alteryx;
VBA;
SQL;
Tableau, MicroStrategy or PowerBI;
ArcGIS, MapIinfo or other GIS software.


Additional Information

What you will get:


Work environment - excellent work conditions with friendly environment, recognized team spirit, and fun and quality recreation time.
Social benefits package including life insurance, food vouchers, additional health insurance for you and a family member, monthly flex allowance including internet bill coverage, sick leave allowance, corporate discounts, marriage and childbirth / adoption allowance, Multisport card, Sharesave plan, Employee assistance program, а birthday gift and many more!
Work-life balance - 25 days paid vacation, 1 additional day off for your birthday and extra 3 paid days for participation in social responsibility events.
Opportunity for flexible working hours and home office.
Personal Development - career pathways for professional growth supported by learning and development programmes and unlimited access to online educational training courses, learning materials & books.


Experian is an Equal opportunity employer. Everyone can succeed at Experian and bring their whole self to work, irrespective of their gender, ethnicity, religion, colour, sexuality, physical ability or age. If you have a disability or special need that requires accommodation, please let us know at the earliest opportunity.

Experian Careers - Creating a better tomorrow together

Find out what its like to work for Experian by clicking here

Title: Analista de datos Junior
Description:
Somos una multinacional canadiense especializada en consultoría tecnológica, con presencia en 21 sectores en más de 400 ubicaciones en todo el mundo, proveemos servicios de consultoría de negocio y de TI integrales, escalables y sostenibles que están analizados globalmente y entregados localmente.




Estamos buscando un/a Analista de Datos (junior) para impulsar nuestro equipo y realizar un trabajo de calidad del dato y realización de modelos de control para un cliente estratégico dentro de un gran proyecto.




Habilidades y Competencias Técnicas:

•Experiencia con Power BI

•Experiencia con SQL

•Experiencia con Python

•Conocimientos en el sector seguros

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
We have a new role for a Data Analyst with a leading institution based in Galway. This is a long-term role with an organisation that can provide a good salary. The role is initially onsite for the first 6 months but after this will move to a hybrid with 2-3 days working from home.




Primary Duties




Support the development and delivery of data and information services
Partner with senior stakeholders to provide dashboards which support decision making
Act as an SME on all data related activities within the function




Requirements




Experience within data analytics
Skills in any of the following including PowerBI, Tableau, Qlik etc
Excellent communication skills




On Offer




The client will provide a good salary of €55,000
The opportunity to work in a flexible working environment after 6 months’ probation
Excellent opportunities for personal and career development

Title: Data Analyst
HTML:
We are looking for a new Data Analyst – Life Insurance. Join our leading life insurance company, where innovation meets tradition. We are on a mission to redefine the future of life insurance, using data to tailor and enhance our services for our clients. At Metropolitan Life, we believe in empowering our employees with the tools and culture they need to thrive and innovate.


As a Data Analyst you will dive deep into our data, using dedicated tools to extract actionable insights that will drive our strategic decisions and keep us at the forefront of the life insurance industry. Some of the key skills required for this role include, but are not limited to, a strong customer focus, the ability to think analytically, effectively, creatively to analyze data and use it to drive decision-driven actions.


Key Responsibilities:


Data Management: Utilize MySQL, Power BI and other internal platforms for complex data querying, manipulation, and analysis across multiple databases. Ensure data integrity and accuracy, perform corrections in all reports and analyses.

Insight Generation: Use Power BI and other internal platforms to create compelling visualizations and dashboards that communicate trends, patterns, and insights to non-technical stakeholders to drive commercial impact.

Business Acumen: Understanding business processes, objectives, and key performance indicators (KPI) to contextualize data analysis with the business context.

Strategic Support: Work closely with cross-functional teams to understand their data needs and provide analytics support that guides decision-making and strategy development to improve customer experience and commercial impact.

Continuous Improvement: Stay abreast of the latest trends and technologies in data analytics and visualization. Recommend and implement improvements to our data practices and tools.

Communication Skills: Strong verbal and written communication skills are necessary to explain technical concepts, present findings, and foster a collaborative environment where data insights and findings are shared and acted upon.

Time management: Efficiently managing time and priorities to meet project deadlines and deliver high-quality results.


Job requirements:


  • Bachelor’s degree in STEM, or a related field;
  • Proficient in SQL, Power BI, Tableau, Excel, CRM platforms;
  • Nice to have data base architecture knowledge;
  • Nice to have Google Analytics, Adobe Analytics knowledge;
  • Minimum of 3-5 years of experience in data analysis, preferably within the insurance or financial services industry;
  • Exceptional analytical and problem-solving skills;
  • Excellent communication skills, with the ability to translate complex data into actionable insights for all levels of the company;
  • A team player who thrives in a fast-paced, collaborative environment.


We value your work, by offering:


  • Friendly environment with multiple career development opportunities;
  • Inclusive and multicultural team where you can create impact with your innovative ideas and creative personality;
  • Various learning & development programs adapted to your needs and goals;
  • Benefits (flexible hours, meal tickets, private medical subscription, insurance policy, Bookster subscription, additional holidays based on seniority, annual performance bonus, holiday bonus, etc);
  • Excellent location – close to public transport stations (bus & subway) & hybrid way of working.


At Metropolitan Life, part of MetLife, Inc, one of the largest life insurance companies in the world, we’re leading the global transformation of an industry we’ve long defined. Named a Certified Great Place to Work, we are united in purpose, diverse in perspective, and dedicated to making a difference in the lives of our customers.


Great Place To Work® Certified in Romania


Metropolitan Life is an equal opportunity, affirmative action employer committed to attracting, retaining, and maximizing the performance of a diverse and inclusive workforce. It is Metropolitan’s Life policy to ensure equal employment opportunity without discrimination or harassment based on race, colour, religion, sex (including pregnancy, childbirth, or related medical conditions), sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, age, disability, national origin, marital or domestic/civil partnership status, genetic information, citizenship status, uniformed service member or veteran status, or any other characteristic protected by law.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Job Description:

We are seeking a skilled and detail-oriented Data Analyst to join our team. The ideal candidate will have strong experience in data analysis, with expertise in SQL, Power BI, and Python. As a Data Analyst, you will be responsible for collecting, analyzing, and interpreting large datasets to drive data-driven decision-making across the organization.




Key Responsibilities:

Extract, manipulate, and analyze data from various databases using SQL.
Create, maintain, and enhance dynamic dashboards and reports using Power BI.
Perform statistical analysis and automate data processes with Python.
Provide actionable insights by identifying trends, patterns, and opportunities.
Collaborate with cross-functional teams to support data-driven strategies.
Ensure data accuracy and integrity through quality checks and validation.




Qualifications:

Proven experience with SQL for database querying and data manipulation.
Proficiency in creating data visualizations and reports using Power BI.
Strong Python skills for data analysis, automation, and modeling.
Excellent analytical and problem-solving skills.
Attention to detail and ability to manage large datasets effectively.
Strong communication skills to present findings clearly to stakeholders.




Preferred:

Experience with cloud platforms (e.g., AWS, Azure) and data engineering is a plus.

Show more

As a Data Analyst, you will be responsible for collecting, analyzing, and interpreting large datasets to drive data-driven decision-making across the organization.


Key Responsibilities:

  • Extract, manipulate, and analyze data from various databases using SQL.
  • Create, maintain, and enhance dynamic dashboards and reports using Power BI.
  • Perform statistical analysis and automate data processes with Python.
  • Provide actionable insights by identifying trends, patterns, and opportunities.
  • Collaborate with cross-functional teams to support data-driven strategies.
  • Ensure data accuracy and integrity through quality checks and validation.


Qualifications:

  • Proven experience with SQL for database querying and data manipulation.
  • Proficiency in creating data visualizations and reports using Power BI.
  • Strong Python skills for data analysis, automation, and modeling.
  • Excellent analytical and problem-solving skills.
  • Attention to detail and ability to manage large datasets effectively.
  • Strong communication skills to present findings clearly to stakeholders.


Preferred:

  • Experience with cloud platforms (e.g., AWS, Azure) and data engineering is a plus.

Title: Data Analyst / Power BI
Description:
We are searching for a Senior Data Analyst / Power BI to strengthen our Microsoft-Team! To join them in working on new upcoming projects.




LACO is a Belgian-based business intelligence and data analytics company that exist for more than 35 years now. We are a Microsoft Data & AI Solutions Partner with extensive expertise in various areas, including Microsoft BI and Data Governance. With over 120 consultants, we are dedicated to helping businesses succeed with data. We blend dedication with a dash of fun in everything we do.




YOUR JOB

As a Data Analyst/Power BI Expert at LACO, you’ll be responsible for:

Understanding and mapping out the requirements of the business.
Collecting, cleaning and pre-processing data from various sources.
Working closely with cross-functional teams and leveraging your expertise in Power BI to create compelling visualizations and reports.
Designing, optimizing, and developing Power BI reports and dashboards to meet business needs and requirements.
Working closely with stakeholders to gather and understand data requirements, ensuring data accuracy and consistency.
Troubleshooting and resolving issues with Power BI reports, transforming complex data sets into meaningful insights through the creation of data visualizations.
Staying up to date with the latest Power BI Microsoft Fabric features and best practices to excel in this role.




YOUR SKILLS

You have a Bachelor’s and/or Master’s degree in computer science or equivalent.
You have an analytical mindset.
You have at least 3 years proven experience as a Power BI Developer or a similar role.
You know all about the programming languages SQL, Dax and Python.
You can model data using Kimball, Dimensional Modelling and Data Vault.
You are proficient in Power BI, including DAX, data modelling and custom visuals.




You get even more bonus points if …

You have a good knowledge of Azure Synapse, Data Factory, and Databricks.
You are familiar with diverse types of data storage for structured data.
You are a strong communicator with teamwork abilities.
You are fluent in Dutch and/or French and English.




OUR OFFER

We’re open to work with Employees and Freelancers
Receive an attractive salary package, along with excellent benefits.
Training opportunities to enhance your knowledge and advance your career in your chosen field.
Be involved in innovative Microsoft tracks that challenge and inspire you.
A great company culture with room for fun events such as: family day, yearly ski trip, sports events, game nights, …




Don’t let this opportunity slip through your data fingers! Get in touch with our Talent Acquisition team and embark on your adventure to success.

Title: DATA ANALYST - VALUE & PERFORMANCE
Place: San Sebastián de los Reyes, Community of Madrid, Spain
Description:
Supongo que muchos de vosotros conoceréis Decathlon, pero por si acaso, Decathlon es un retailer de deporte y bienestar con 1.600 tiendas en más de 70 países, movilizados por un mismo sentido




MOVE PEOPLE THROUGH THE WONDERS OF SPORT




Con la evolución de nuestro modelo de negocio y el crecimiento digital actual, nos estamos enfrentando a complejos desafíos a gran escala que requieren del mejor talento para superarlos con éxito y poner la Inteligencia Artificial al servicio de las personas.




Quién eres

Te apasionan la tecnología, el deporte y los datos
Jugar en equipo te da energía. Colaborar y crear de forma colectiva con personas a tu alrededor forma parte de quien eres.
Te gusta explorar, crear, descubrir, no dejas ningún detalle al azar. Aprendes haciendo y rehaciendo
Estás dispuesta(o) a enfrentarte a lo desconocido, te motiva el reto y el desafío
Ves una oportunidad cuando las cosas cambian a tu alrededor.
Te gusta emprender. Disfrutas tomando responsabilidades y no te preocupa equivocarte tomando decisiones (no te preocupes, a nosotros tampoco)
Disfrutas con el análisis y la anticipación y eres muy organizada(o)
Eres un(a) gran comunicador(a) . Disfrutas compartiendo tu conocimiento y lo haces de forma clara y sencilla.
Te preocupa la sostenibilidad y actúas para generar un menor impacto en el medio ambiente




Qué harás

Acompañaras al equipo de Value & Performance mediante el manejo y análisis de los datos de la actividad centrado en un análisis de mercado.
Contribuirás / Acompañarás la toma de decisiones mediante el análisis descriptivo , y el diagnóstico a través de los datos con los que aconsejarás planes de acción. En particular a identificar patrones
Construirás informes , visualizaciones y cuadros de mando con herramientas de exploración y autoservicio como Tableau.
Realizarás análisis exploratorio de datos desde fuentes primarias mediante consultas a bases de datos con SQL
Utilizaras técnicas estadísticas básicas para elaborar por ejemplo regresiones, distribuciones , o análisis de variabilidad
Realizarás análisis predictivos para ayudar en la anticipación de la actividad y la previsión de la evolución de sus métricas clave
Estarás en contacto permanente con el equipo de Data e IA para la coordinación de acciones y proyectos, así como con la dirección comercial.
Formarás parte de una comunidad de analistas de la empresa vinculados a otras áreas de negocio con los que compartirás información, experiencias y conocimiento
Estarás en contacto con equipos locales , e internacionales en otros países para la sincronización de trabajos en proyectos conjuntos que elaboramos en común
Serás una parte activa de la gestión del cambio para promover el uso extenso de los datos para la toma de decisiones.




Qué te ofrecemos

Contrato indefinido
Estar rodeada(o) de personas que disfrutan también de trabajar construyendo colectivamente, de compartir, y que disfrutan de los retos y el deporte al ritmo de cada uno.
Formación según una trayectoria que tú construirás, en un entorno que te invitara a tomar decisiones a diario y donde todos consideran que equivocarse también forma parte del proceso.
Entorno de trabajo muy poco jerarquizado donde la toma de decisión está muy distribuida y que favorece la promoción interna
Plan de desarrollo profesional
Libertad y responsabilidad. Ser emprendedor de tu vida, creador de tu propio viaje.




Qué necesitas

Fuertes principios y experiencia práctica contrastable en entornos de Análisis de datos y de datos en el ámbito de conocimiento de mercado.
Experiencia en el diseño de sistemas de visualización de datos
Experiencia en el manejo de hojas de cálculo (Excel, Google Sheets, etc..)
Generación de hipótesis y experimentación mediante tests A/B
Fluidez en Python.
Visualización y análisis de datos con pandas, matplotlib ,numpy y seaborn.
Fuerte experiencia con SQL y en la manipulación de datasets masivos, especialmente en Databricks y BigQuery
Eres un(a) Data Story Maker; te desenvuelves bien y disfrutas explicando los conceptos de Datos y Data Science para hacerlos comprensibles para stakeholders y usuarios
Muy alto nivel de Inglés, hablado y escrito. Lo usarás a diario en tu trabajo
Experiencia trabajando con marcos Agile y experimentación
Te desenvuelves bien con entornos como Databricks y notebooks como Jupyter
Será un plus
Uso de técnicas estadísticas avanzadas
Hablar Francés
Conocimiento de técnicas y librerías de ML
Conocimiento de entornos en la nube como GCP o AWS




Si te sientes identificado/a, tienes ganas y quieres aportar al proyecto de Decathlon. ¡Únete, te estamos esperando!

  • Experiencia en el diseño de sistemas de visualización de datos

Title: Media Data Analyst
Description:
Company Description

H&M is a fashion brand that offers the latest styles and inspiration, from fashion pieces and unique designer collaborations to affordable wardrobe essentials. Our business idea is fashion & quality at the best price in a sustainable way. Learn more about H&M here.

Sales is a global function within the H&M brand with the mission of growing and engaging our customer base, as well as growing and developing our sales channels. By holding the responsibility for our regions and bringing together expertise from both business and digital & tech perspectives, Sales plays a key role in delivering on our Brand Plan - to elevate H&M through product, experience, and brand providing aspirational fashion at an unbeatable price.

The mission of the Customer Activation unit in Sales is to create a strategic plan that brings our brand direction to life through different touch points. Through data and customer insights, we design and execute a plan that will ensure a holistic customer experience from communication with our customer to our membership program. 

Job Description

In the role you will belong to the Product Data Analytics team and will be working within the product teams of the Value Stream Activate. Our Value Stream is developing and delivering a comprehensive range of products and features that cater to various stages of the customer activation journey. We enable tech solutions for our CRM and membership program, as well as across the media channels (Google, Meta, TikTok, Snapchat, etc.) By leveraging innovative technology, data-driven insights, and a deep understanding of customer behavior, we strive to create a seamless customer journey throughout the funnel as well as provide our regional teams and relevant business stakeholders with the tools they need to effectively engage, retain, and maximize the value of our customers.

As Product Data Analyst you will be key in driving data-driven product development. As an essential member of the product team you will support in shaping product roadmaps, enable understanding of the value delivered by the product team, will set and monitor KPIs for measuring success, will provide insights supporting strategic decisions. We believe you have strong leadership to drive analytical agenda within the cross-functional team and across many stakeholders (global commercial teams, analytical community, business tech teams, possibly external partners).

In this role you will:


Be responsible for understanding and communicating the value the product team delivers to our customers and our business.
Support in creating business cases that would inform our product development roadmaps and make sure we prioritize the right initiatives, as well as follow up on how the value is materialized once the development has been delivered.
Translate the analysis performed into actionable insights and effectively advocate the insights across various stakeholders within and outside the Value Stream.
Use SQL, SAS, Google BigQuery, Google Looker, PowerBI and other analytical tools to dive deep into our data, as well as be an expert within data relevant for your product(s). You will also have an opportunity to drive requirements towards the teams building our data products.
Advocate for data-driven product development by defining success metrics (OKRs and KPIs), driving a/b test agenda, setting tracking framework for the newly developed features to ensure we are collecting high quality data.
Participate in the wider analytical community within Customer Activation, Sales and broadly H&M Group to grow our collective knowledge and skills.



Qualifications


2+ years of experience in analytics, preferably as a data analyst in an agile product team setting.
Academic degree within Business, Economics, Statistics, Engineering (or similar).
Knowledge in SQL and experience in handling large datasets across multiple data sources.
Experience with digital and media data, as well as good command of customer data
Understand online media metrics from advertising platforms such as Google, Meta, TikTok, Snapchat, etc
Understand how online media use attribution windows
Understand metrics from GA & GA4
Strong business context related to the product data analysts works with
Ability to synthesize data into clear insights and communicate complex problems in a simple way across different types of audiences (both technical and non-technical) in a matrix organization.
Analytical mindset and ability to lead with data-driven insights within a cross-functional team.
Preferred to have experience with GCP (BigQuery) or Databricks and from working with data visualization tools (Looker Studio, Looker, PowerBI, etc.)
It is beneficial if you have experience of working with loyalty or membership programs.
Preferred to have experience with web analytics data, a/b testing methodologies and tracking development.
Fluent in English (written and spoken).



Additional Information

This is a fulltime position with placement in Stockholm. If your experience, skills, and ambitions are right for this role, please apply with CV in English.

Please do not send applications to individual email address, due to GDPR, we only accept applications through our career page. We look forward to receiving your application!

Benefits

We offer all our employees at H&M Group attractive benefits with extensive development opportunities around the globe. All our employees receive a staff discount card, usable on all our H&M Group brands in stores and online. Brands covered by the discount are H&M (Beauty and Move included), COS, Weekday, Monki, H&M HOME, & Other Stories, ARKET, Afound. In addition to our staff discount, all our employees are included in our H&M Incentive Program – HIP. You can read more about our H&M Incentive Program here.

In addition to our global benefits, all our local markets offer different competitive perks and benefits. Please note that they may differ between employment type and countries.

Title: Associate Data Analyst
Description:
Company Description

Experian is a global data and technology company, powering opportunities for people and businesses around the world. We help to redefine lending practices, uncover and prevent fraud, simplify healthcare, create digital marketing solutions, and gain deeper insights into the automotive market, all using our unique combination of data, analytics and software. We also assist millions of people to realise their financial goals and help them to save time and money.

We operate across a range of markets, from financial services to healthcare, automotive, agribusiness, insurance, and many more industry segments.

We invest in people and new advanced technologies to unlock the power of data. As a FTSE 100 Index company listed on the London Stock Exchange (EXPN), we have a team of 22,500 people across 32 countries. Our corporate headquarters are in Dublin, Ireland.

Job Description

We are recruiting for a role within our Marketing Analytics team. The Associate Data Analyst is reporting into the Targeting Analytics Manager.

What you'll be doing?

You will deliver analytical projects; this will involve analyzing data sets, getting to the bottom of what is going on with the data and communicating your findings to different stakeholders within Experian.

Working with your team, you will blend a knowledge of mathematical, analytical or spatial techniques with a natural curiosity for understanding and analysing data.

Qualifications

What you'll bring?

Skills

We're after a team player who has a desire to deliver analysis projects to budgeted time, with accuracy, using core analytical techniques and applications. Enthusiasm and determination to develop your skills. Therefore, you'll bring:


Mathematical competency;
Geospatial/GIS expertise;
Data analysis and interpretation.


The following additional skills would be advantageous but not essential:


Regression Modelling;
Segmentation;
Machine Learning;
Location analysis.


It Would Be Great If You Have Previous Experience Of Data Analysis And Interpretation And An Understanding Of Any Programming Languages And Applications Such As


R;
Python;
SAS;
Alteryx;
VBA;
SQL;
Tableau, MicroStrategy or PowerBI;
ArcGIS, MapIinfo or other GIS software.


Additional Information

What you will get:


Work environment - excellent work conditions with friendly environment, recognized team spirit, and fun and quality recreation time.
Social benefits package including life insurance, food vouchers, additional health insurance for you and a family member, monthly flex allowance including internet bill coverage, sick leave allowance, corporate discounts, marriage and childbirth / adoption allowance, Multisport card, Sharesave plan, Employee assistance program, а birthday gift and many more!
Work-life balance - 25 days paid vacation, 1 additional day off for your birthday and extra 3 paid days for participation in social responsibility events.
Opportunity for flexible working hours and home office.
Personal Development - career pathways for professional growth supported by learning and development programmes and unlimited access to online educational training courses, learning materials & books.


Experian is an Equal opportunity employer. Everyone can succeed at Experian and bring their whole self to work, irrespective of their gender, ethnicity, religion, colour, sexuality, physical ability or age. If you have a disability or special need that requires accommodation, please let us know at the earliest opportunity.

Experian Careers - Creating a better tomorrow together

Find out what its like to work for Experian by clicking here


Show more

We're after a team player who has a desire to deliver analysis projects to budgeted time, with accuracy, using core analytical techniques and applications. Enthusiasm and determination to develop your skills. Therefore, you'll bring:

  • Mathematical competency;
  • Geospatial/GIS expertise;
  • Data analysis and interpretation.

The following additional skills would be advantageous but not essential:

  • Regression Modelling;
  • Segmentation;
  • Machine Learning;
  • Location analysis.

It Would Be Great If You Have Previous Experience Of Data Analysis And Interpretation And An Understanding Of Any Programming Languages And Applications Such As

  • R;
  • Python;
  • SAS;
  • Alteryx;
  • VBA;
  • SQL;
  • Tableau, MicroStrategy or PowerBI;
  • ArcGIS, MapIinfo or other GIS software.

Additional Information

What you will get:

  • Work environment - excellent work conditions with friendly environment, recognized team spirit, and fun and quality recreation time.
  • Social benefits package including life insurance, food vouchers, additional health insurance for you and a family member, monthly flex allowance including internet bill coverage, sick leave allowance, corporate discounts, marriage and childbirth / adoption allowance, Multisport card, Sharesave plan, Employee assistance program, а birthday gift and many more!
  • Work-life balance - 25 days paid vacation, 1 additional day off for your birthday and extra 3 paid days for participation in social responsibility events.
  • Opportunity for flexible working hours and home office.
  • Personal Development - career pathways for professional growth supported by learning and development programmes and unlimited access to online educational training courses, learning materials & books.

Experian is an Equal opportunity employer. Everyone can succeed at Experian and bring their whole self to work, irrespective of their gender, ethnicity, religion, colour, sexuality, physical ability or age. If you have a disability or special need that requires accommodation, please let us know at the earliest opportunity.

Experian Careers - Creating a better tomorrow together

Find out what its like to work for Experian by clicking here

Title: DATA ANALYSIS INTERN
Description:
Job Responsibilities

De'Longhi Group, one of the world’s leading players in the household appliance sector and mainly active in the coffee and food preparation segment, offers:


a multinational and stimulating environment;
exciting growth opportunities:
a strong work-life balance;


Within our Italian Commercial Subsidiary, we are looking for a talented Data Analysis Intern that will work closely with our cross-functional teams to extract, analyze, and interpret data from various sources to support key business initiatives. This role offers exposure to diverse datasets and the chance to apply statistical and analytical techniques to solve real-world business challenges. The role will play a crucial role in providing insights that drive informed decision-making in marketing, pricing, sales, trade marketing, logistics, and forecasting.

Key Responsibilities include:


Collect and clean data from multiple sources to ensure accuracy and completeness.
Develop and implement data quality checks to maintain reliable datasets.
Perform statistical analysis on marketing, pricing, sales, trade marketing, logistics, and forecasting data.
Create insightful visualizations and reports to communicate findings to stakeholders.
Identify trends, patterns, and outliers in the data to inform business strategies.
Explore opportunities for predictive modelling to enhance decision-making processes.


What we offer:


Internship starting in September
Duration: 6 months
Working hours: Full-time
650 euro monthly reimbursement
Free lunch canteen


Job Profile


Economics, Management or Marketing Degree (undergraduate or postgraduate);
Passion for data and numbers;
Organizational skills, flexibility, team working ability, hands-on approach;
Proficient in data analysis tools such as Python, R, or similar.
Experience with data visualization tools (e.g., SAP Analytics Cloud, Power BI) is a plus.
Good level of English;
Good Microsoft Excel skills;
Ability to pick up new technologies quickly and independently;
Strong analytical and problem-solving skills with a keen attention to detail.


We are an Equal Opportunity Employer, we reject and condemn any form of discrimination including discrimination based on age, gender, sexual orientation, health, race, nationality, cultural background, political opinions and religious beliefs, and membership of associations and trade unions.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
In a fast-changing and uncertain world, the right insights make the difference between seizing an opportunity and missing it entirely. Kline Energy helps energy and mobility clients across the world win in the market through timely advisory services following an agile, client-first organization. Our client base includes global energy companies and regional energy players, you will be able to influence the decisions of the key companies in the Energy industry




Kline recognizes the power of knowledge to anticipate change, unlock value and drive growth.

As a Data Analyst, you will combine strong analytical skills and a strategic mindset with real-world perspectives driven by an understanding of client issues and broader marketplace drivers. You will be working on projects related to different markets, countries globally and will interact with colleagues located in different countries. An Analyst's primary responsibility will be to analyze global markets, develop competitive and technical information, and build solid analysis and insights for client engagements.




Job Description:

As an integral part of the global project team within Kline’s Energy Practice, a Data Analyst will be expected to utilize the best-suited tools to research key markets and develop strategic recommendations for global clients, including:

Use data analytics to enhance clients’ understanding of key business, risk, strategic, or regulatory issues;
Manipulate and analyze large volumes of disparate data to develop critical insights for our clients’ issues, or business decision-making
Build statistical and machine learning models, or custom visualizations and applications, to detect patterns, trends, outliers and drivers among relevant business issues;
Apply predictive analytics, statistical modelling for both internal and external clients.
Assist with the collection, loading, standardization, and identification of relevant data for analysis;
Communicate findings from your analyses to your team members through visuals, data tables and models, and assist with the development of final deliverables, reports, and presentations to be distributed to clients;
Work closely with business stakeholders and experts in order to develop new and innovative tools to support the evolving data landscape, and stay up to date with developments in data analytics, solution architecture and programming languages;
This is NOT a technical IT role.







Job Requirements:

Bachelor’s or Master’s degree (preferred) with an academic focus on quantitative research (Computer Science and Engineering, Data Analytics, Statistics, Biostatistics, Mathematics, Operations Research, Machine Learning, Management Information Systems, or Security Information Systems or related).
In addition, at least 4-6 years of pertinent industry experience in consulting, market research and/or competitive intelligence, or strategic marketing is ideal, with excellent analytical, modelling, strong communication and presentation skills is essential.
Candidates should have strong quantitative, analytical, and conceptual problem-solving skills, combined with outstanding business acumen.
Experience in data visualization using Excel, Power BI, Tableau
This position is currently home-office/remote-based. Kline & Company offers a competitive compensation and benefits package in a supportive work environment.
Show more

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
*Availability to travel Middle East (25% of the time/Year)*




Who are we:




Neotalent Conclusion is one of the leading Iberian specialists providing services in Information Technology and Engineering services. As part of the Netherlands-based organization Conclusion, which has an ecosystem of over 25 companies and 3,600 employees, we are focused on increasing the technological capacity of our clients and the digital transformation of their application ecosystems.

We are talent specialists, attracting the best people and combining them with the needs of the most ambitious projects, at the right time. Our success comes from our investments in innovation, our focus on results, and, above all, the guarantee that our people will have happy and rewarding careers.

With over 25 years of solid experience, Neotalent Conclusion has established its presence in key locations, including Lisbon, Porto, and Madrid. The company currently has more than 950 professionals in the different areas in which it operates.

Neotalent, the responsive people.




Find out more about us at www.neotalent.pt.




Role Overview:




We are looking for a Data Analyst to join one of our largest international partners in the Telecommunications sector. It is one of the biggest references in the area, with a significant presence in more than 6 countries.




What you will do:




Data Analyst is responsible for examining and interpreting complex data sets to derive meaningful insights and support business decision-making. Focused on descriptive and diagnostic analytics to answer questions of where your company has been, where it is now, why things are the way they are now, and support the decision about what are the next steps.

Their mission involves organizing data, conducting statistical analysis, creating data models, and collecting data requirements from Businesses.

Data analysts collaborate with different teams to understand their analytical requirements, identify key metrics, and communicate data-driven findings to stakeholders effectively.




As a part of your job, you will:

Gathering and analyzing business requirements to determine the best solution for data reporting and analysis.
Designing data solutions such as data warehousing, data marts, dashboards, and reporting systems.
Developing and maintaining data models, reports, and visualizations.
Collaborating with IT teams to ensure proper data integration and management.
Assisting stakeholders in interpreting data insights and making informed business decisions.




What you are like:




Proficiency in SQL for data querying and analysis;
Experience with data visualization tools (e.g., Tableau, Power BI, or Matplotlib);
Knowledge of statistical analysis techniques and tools (e.g., R, Python libraries like pandas);
Ability to interpret and analyze complex data sets;
Familiarity with data cleansing and preparation techniques.




Why join us:




• Work on challenging projects for big clients

• Learn more about emerging technologies

• Possibility of working remotely

• Design your career plan

• Access to continuous training and certifications

• Evolve through our internal mobility program

• … and much more!
