Title: Junior Data Analyst
Description:
We’re the world’s leading data, insights, and consulting company; we shape the brands of tomorrow by better understanding people everywhere.

Worldpanel provides brands and retailers with a unique, 360-degree understanding of consumer behaviour across the globe. We are shopper-centric, continuously monitoring the purchase and usage behaviour through the largest omnipanel in the world. With unparalleled datasets, pioneering technology and expert analysts, we partner with brands and retailers of all sizes, empowering them to reimagine what’s possible, and change the landscape to create a better, healthier, more sustainable and inclusive world.

Job Details

INSPIRE SUCCESSFUL DECISIONS

Kantar’s Worldpanel division is searching for an inquisitive and dedicated entry-level Data Analyst. Based in Lisbon, Portugal this is an incredible opportunity to be part of our exciting vision for the future!

The Team and Role’s mission

Does the idea of working with a large set of information and complex data, using innovative analysis techniques in order to achieve the best solutions for different businesses and for leading global brands in the market attract you?

We are aiming to recruit a recent graduate who’d like to join us as a Junior Data Analyst at our Advanced Analytics Centre of Excellence (CoE) team in Lisbon – with the opportunity to rapidly increase their expertise in the field of Data Science and Analytics, working and learning from a group of analysts and with some of the most powerful analysis tools and techniques that can be used to understand today’s data.

Using information from market-leading consumer panels and advanced data analysis techniques, you will support our customers’ needs and answer their toughest marketing-related questions with data insights and support their business growth.

You’ll be working with a team of like-minded Data Analysts within our Lisbon hub, carrying out data modelling processes for projects sold by our Expert Solutions teams around the world – you’ll work with a variety of different analytical techniques, datasets and brands to help answer a range of research and marketing questions from “How well did my advertising campaign perform?” to “Which products does my brand compete with?”.

At Worldpanel by Kantar, we are also currently embarking on a major shift in how we deliver analysis to our clients, with a new, best-in-class online platform (MyWorldPanel) through which we will deliver a suite of predictive analytics. This major development will not only step-change our client’s experience of using our data – you’ll also be involved in the transition of our analytics processes to this new cloud-based environment, helping to drive the quality, scale and efficiency of our solutions forward.

If you’re willing to go beyond the obvious, using intelligence, passion, and creativity to inspire new thinking and shape the world we live in, apply for a career that’ll be out of the ordinary and join us!

Key outcomes


Work with Kantar Worldpanel local commercial teams to deliver analytical outputs for projects which will help our clients (brand owners and retailers) to better understand their markets and consumers.
Apply a range of statistical techniques and modelling processes to transactional and attitudinal data to help answer our clients’ business questions.
Work on the development of new skills, new analytical approaches and new ways of representing insight.
Work closely with other branches within the Centre of Excellence to support the development and improvement of advanced analytical techniques and the migration to a cloud-based platform.


Key Capabilities

Your background will ideally look like this…


University Degree (Bachelor’s or Master’s Degree) in Statistics, Mathematics, Computer Science, Physics, Econometrics or equivalent quantitative fields.
Business proficiency in English (B2 Level Minimum required).
Proven knowledge of SQL and R-Studio is mandatory.
Proven Knowledge/experience in SAS (Enterprise Guide) and Python although not required will be appreciated.


With the following qualities…


Inquisitive, with critical thinking, and demonstrates a genuine passion for consumer behaviour.
Enjoys actively looking for new and more efficient ways of improving processes, raising standards, reducing errors, and overcoming omissions.
Is proactive, optimistic, and willing to get involved to achieve the team's goals and objectives.
Is highly collaborative and adaptable with the ability to work optimally within different cultural and technical environments.
Possesses outstanding communication and interpersonal skills in order to connect with partners at all levels across the organization comfortably and facilitates discussions in a constructive manner.


What Our Recruitment Process Looks Like...


1st Stage – Numerical Reasoning Assessment Test.
2nd Stage – Screening Interview with TA.
3rd Stage – Final Meeting with Hiring Managers.


Country

Portugal

Why join Kantar?

We shape the brands of tomorrow by better understanding people everywhere. By understanding people, we can understand what drives their decisions, actions, and aspirations on a global scale. And by amplifying our in-depth expertise of human understanding alongside ground-breaking technology, we can help brands find concrete insights that will help them succeed in our fast-paced, ever shifting world.

And because we know people, we like to make sure our own people are being looked after as well. Equality of opportunity for everyone is our highest priority and we support our colleagues to work in a way that supports their health and wellbeing. While we encourage teams to spend part of their working week in the office, we understand no one size fits all; our approach is flexible to ensure everybody feels included, accepted, and that we can win together. We’re dedicated to creating an inclusive culture and value the diversity of our people, clients, suppliers and communities, and we encourage applications from all backgrounds and sections of society. Even if you feel like you’re not an exact match, we’d love to receive your application and talk to you about this job or others at Kantar.


Show more

Title: Data analyst
Description:
Producteur indépendant d’hydrocarbures, Perenco opère à toutes les étapes du cycle de vie des projets, de l’exploration au démantèlement.

Chaque jour, nous sommes confrontés aux défis de la création d’un avenir énergétique plus durable. Animés par l’audace et l’innovation, nous plaçons la performance au service du développement.

Chez Perenco, au-delà de vos compétences, nous accordons une grande importance à votre personnalité. A nos côtés, vous aurez l’opportunité d’affirmer votre potentiel et de vous créer un parcours professionnel unique et riche en expériences.




Description du poste:

Nous recherchons un Data analyst pour rejoindre notre équipe au sein de la Direction audit et performance opérationnelle et contribuer à la conception et à la maintenance de nos applications métiers. Le candidat retenu travaillera en étroite collaboration avec nos équipes métiers pour comprendre leurs besoins et concevoir des solutions pour répondre à leurs besoins. Vous mettrez en œuvre des tableaux de bord de suivi des performances et des indicateurs de performance clés, et faciliterez l'accès aux informations grâce à des outils de reporting et d'analyse.




Responsabilités principales:

Concevoir et maintenir les rapports PowerBI de la société,
Collaborer avec les équipes métiers pour comprendre leurs besoins en matière de données et concevoir des solutions pour répondre à ces besoins,
Collaborer avec les équipes Data de la DSI pour développer des interfaces, des API, de nouveaux référenciels data afin de faciliter la mise en production de nouveaux outils digitaux,
Participer avec les data Owners et l’équipe Data à la définition des produits de données pour l’ensemble du Groupe,
Utiliser Snowflake et dbt pour concevoir des produits de données pertinents pour les besoins du services ou d’autres départements,
Créer des tableaux de bord PowerBI interactifs et des visualisations pour communiquer des insights aux équipes métiers,
Assurer la qualité et la précision des données utilisées dans les rapports et les applications,
Travailler en étroite collaboration avec les équipes de la DSI pour s'assurer que les solutions proposées sont conformes aux normes de sécurité et de confidentialité de l'entreprise.

Notre Stack :

Data architecture : Snowflake et dbt,
Reporting : écosystème PowerBi,
Bonne connaissance des technologies SQL et noSQL,
Langage de développement : Python.




Qualifications requises:

Anglais courant, espagnol apprécié,
Stage de fin d'études en informatique, statistiques ou domaine connexe,
Maîtrise de Python et SQL pour extraire et manipuler des données,
Compétences en analyse de données et en visualisation pour communiquer efficacement des insights aux équipes métiers,
Excellentes compétences en communication pour travailler en étroite collaboration avec les équipes métiers et DSI,
Capacité à travailler de manière autonome, vos prises d'initiatives sont fortement encouragées.




Soft skills :

Forte adaptabilité, capable d’évoluer dans un contexte agile et exigeant,
Rigueur, esprit d'analyse et de synthèse,
Bon relationnel et esprit d'équipe,
Force de proposition pour optimiser l’existant.

Show more

Responsabilités principales:

  • Concevoir et maintenir les rapports PowerBI de la société,
  • Collaborer avec les équipes métiers pour comprendre leurs besoins en matière de données et concevoir des solutions pour répondre à ces besoins,
  • Collaborer avec les équipes Data de la DSI pour développer des interfaces, des API, de nouveaux référenciels data afin de faciliter la mise en production de nouveaux outils digitaux,
  • Participer avec les data Owners et l’équipe Data à la définition des produits de données pour l’ensemble du Groupe,
  • Utiliser Snowflake et dbt pour concevoir des produits de données pertinents pour les besoins du services ou d’autres départements,
  • Créer des tableaux de bord PowerBI interactifs et des visualisations pour communiquer des insights aux équipes métiers,
  • Assurer la qualité et la précision des données utilisées dans les rapports et les applications,
  • Travailler en étroite collaboration avec les équipes de la DSI pour s'assurer que les solutions proposées sont conformes aux normes de sécurité et de confidentialité de l'entreprise.

Notre Stack :

  • Data architecture : Snowflake et dbt,
  • Reporting : écosystème PowerBi,
  • Bonne connaissance des technologies SQL et noSQL,
  • Langage de développement : Python.


Qualifications requises:

  • Anglais courant, espagnol apprécié,
  • Stage de fin d'études en informatique, statistiques ou domaine connexe,
  • Maîtrise de Python et SQL pour extraire et manipuler des données,
  • Compétences en analyse de données et en visualisation pour communiquer efficacement des insights aux équipes métiers,
  • Excellentes compétences en communication pour travailler en étroite collaboration avec les équipes métiers et DSI,
  • Capacité à travailler de manière autonome, vos prises d'initiatives sont fortement encouragées.


Soft skills :

  • Forte adaptabilité, capable d’évoluer dans un contexte agile et exigeant,
  • Rigueur, esprit d'analyse et de synthèse,
  • Bon relationnel et esprit d'équipe,
  • Force de proposition pour optimiser l’existant.

Title: Data Analyst - Marketing Digital
Description:
🌍“Cuidar de las personas y empresas para hacer del mundo un lugar más seguro, manteniéndonos a la vanguardia de la innovación” es lo que nos motiva desde hace más de 40 años.

Y lo hacemos utilizando las tecnologías más punteras (IA, IoT, Data Science, Blockchange, etc.) para ofrecer soluciones disruptivas a través de nuestras cinco líneas de negocio: Security, Cash, Alarms, Cipher y AVOS.




Dentro de Movistar Prosegur Alarmas, queremos incorporar un Data Analyst para el departamento de Marketing Digital.




👨‍💻 ¿Qué responsabilidades vas a tener?




Será responsable de crear informes de análisis de datos, realizar previsiones de volumen de negocio y crear/ejecutar consultas ad hoc para las distintas necesidades de la empresa.
Será el responsable de agilizar los procesos relacionados con la recopilación, el procesamiento y el análisis de datos, incluida la automatización de informes, y presenta datos complejos de forma sencilla y comprensible para obtener información valiosa.
Desempeñará un papel fundamental a la hora de ayudar a los distintos departamentos de la compañía a tomar decisiones informadas basadas en datos, contribuyendo al crecimiento y al éxito de la empresa.
Trabajará de manera muy conectado con el Data Engineer, informando las necesidades de información que tiene para responder a las solicitudes de la compañía.




Funciones:

Importar, limpiar, transformar, validar y modelar datos con el fin de comprenderlos y extraer conclusiones para la toma de decisiones.
Crear representaciones visuales de los datos, como cuadros de mando y paneles de control.
Interpretar los resultados de los análisis de datos y proporcionar ideas y recomendaciones prácticas basadas en las conclusiones. Garantizar la exactitud e integridad de los datos durante todo el proceso de análisis.
Apoyar el conocimiento de los datos para aumentar el rendimiento del departamento y contribuir a la planificación estratégica y a los procesos de toma de decisiones.
Estar al día de las últimas herramientas de análisis de datos, técnicas y tendencias del sector.
Trabajar con equipos interfuncionales en un entorno dinámico.
Capacidad de gestionar proveedores internos y externos para traccionar las iniciativas.




🙋‍♀️¿Qué perfil estamos buscando?




Formación: Licenciatura en matemáticas, estadística, economía, ingeniería o ADE
Experiencia mínima de 3 años en un rol similar.
Dominio de herramientas y lenguajes de manipulación de datos como SQL, Python y Excel (Power Query y DAX)
Conocimiento avanzado de Power BI
Experiencia trabajando con Google Platform en entorno Cloud.
Deseables conocimientos en: Salesforce, Tableau, Magnolia, Delio, Looker




📑¿Qué te ofrecemos?




Contrato indefinido.
Salario según Valía del candidato: Fijo + variable
Formato Híbrido de teletrabajo.
Trabajar en un entorno dinámico con un excelente ambiente laboral
Participar en proyectos estratégicos y disruptivos
Crecer profesionalmente atendiendo a un plan carrera personalizado
Acceder a un plan formativo de primer nivel gracias a la Universidad Corporativa de Prosegur
Disponer de flexibilidad horaria y de interesantes beneficios sociales
Disfrutar de nuestro Programa Global de Bienestar
Colaborar con nuestra Fundación para crear una sociedad más justa.










🧑🏻‍🤝‍🧑Si quieres formar parte del equipo Movistar Prosegur Alarmas, ¡Aplica a esta vacante para comenzar tu aventura con nosotros! Estamos deseando conocerte.

  • Crecer profesionalmente atendiendo a un plan carrera personalizado
  • Acceder a un plan formativo de primer nivel gracias a la Universidad Corporativa de Prosegur
  • Disponer de flexibilidad horaria y de interesantes beneficios sociales
  • Disfrutar de nuestro Programa Global de Bienestar
  • Colaborar con nuestra Fundación para crear una sociedad más justa.




🧑🏻‍🤝‍🧑Si quieres formar parte del equipo Movistar Prosegur Alarmas, ¡Aplica a esta vacante para comenzar tu aventura con nosotros! Estamos deseando conocerte.

Title: Data Analyst Working Student
Description:
Lovehoney Group is the world’s leading sexual wellbeing company. We offer exciting brands with innovative, high-quality sex toys, lingerie, and accessories in a smooth online shopping experience.

Lovehoney employs over 900 awesome, diverse & driven people throughout our 9 offices across the globe, celebrating a broad spectrum of talents in engineering, industrial design, sales, and marketing.

We are proud to be a company that thrives by doing things differently, challenging expectations and stereotypes while making a positive impact on our customers’ lives.

We are currently recruiting a Working Student Data Analyst who will be integral to driving high-level performance across Lovehoney Group. Your focus will be on leveraging our technology stack to derive insights and support various teams within the business.

What You Will Do


Utilize tools like Google Analytics, Big Query, Airflow, Tableau, and Superset to analyse data from our group data warehouse
Collaborate with finance, marketing, and product teams to produce reporting capabilities and insights
Develop visualizations and storytelling to communicate complex data analysis in an understandable manner
Understand and apply core e-commerce KPIs in your analysis
Utilize your analytical and problem-solving skills to identify trends and insights



What You Should Bring


Currently enrolled in a degree in business, mathematics, science, or engineering
Experience in writing and reviewing SQL queries
Proficiency in building visualizations and data storytelling
Understanding of core e-commerce KPIs
Strong analytical, problem-solving, and communication skills



What We Can Offer You


A welcoming workplace full of drinks, snacks, and friendly faces, as well as a range of benefits that make working with us an unforgettable experience.
Fun team-building events, including dinners, barbecues, and games, that bring our team together and foster a sense of community
Discount Shopping Portal: Access to unique discounts at high street retailers, hotels, and service providers through Perks at Work.
A hybrid work model that allows for flexibility and work-life balance, with three days a week in-office
25 holiday days a year, plus an extra day for every year you are with Lovehoney, giving you plenty of time to rest, recharge, and explore



Lovehoney Group is an equal opportunities employer. We promise that every qualified person will be evaluated according to skills regardless of age, disability, gender reassignment, marriage and civil partnership, pregnancy and maternity, race, religion or belief, sex, or sexual orientation.

If you require accommodations during the interview process due to a disability, please inform your Talent Acquisition Specialist so that we can ensure a smooth and inclusive experience for all candidates.

At Lovehoney Group, we leverage artificial intelligence as part of our screening interview process, for note-taking purposes. Rest assured, we prioritize transparency and respect candidates' preferences. You'll have the option to opt out while still receiving fair consideration for the role.

We currently have a hybrid work model supporting a blend of in-office and remote work (3 days per week in-office)

If we sparked your interest and you are open to embarking on your professional path with us, please visit our Lovehoney careers page to apply: https://jobs.eu.lever.co/lovehoneygroup

Our privacy policy is available here: https://www.lovehoneygroup.com/privacy-policy/

Title: Data analysis stage
Description:
Ewiva ha l’obiettivo di costruire una rete di oltre 3.000 punti di ricarica ultra-veloci, ad alta potenza (fino a 350 kW) distribuiti in tutta Italia consentendo quindi di ricaricare su tutto il territorio nazionale, in qualsiasi momento, e ripartire in pochi minuti.




Il futuro sostenibile è oggi. Il raggiungimento degli obiettivi di neutralità climatica previsti dal Green Deal europeo, vale a dire azzerare le emissioni a effetto serra entro il 2050, si fonda sulle scelte che facciamo oggi e noi di Ewiva vogliamo essere protagonisti di questo traguardo decisivo per la salute del nostro pianeta.




Ewiva è una Joint Venture tra Enel X e il Gruppo Volkswagen, nata per accelerare la transizione del Paese verso la mobilità elettrica sviluppando una infrastruttura di ricarica ultra-veloce alla portata di tutti e su tutto il territorio nazionale.




Ewiva sta cercando uno stage nel Team Quality assurance per i suoi uffici di Milano.

Inserita in un contesto giovane e dinamico la figura ricercata si occuperà di:

Sviluppo e realizzazione di report periodici per il Management
Supporto nell'impostazione e nell'aggiornamento delle dashboard KPI in Microsoft PowerBI
Monitoraggio e analisi dei dati di performance della rete di ricarica
Supporto nello sviluppo della rete di ricarica attraverso l'analisi di diversi set di dati per definire le aree target per nuove stazioni di ricarica
Supporto nel processo di valutazione e approvazione delle nuove stazioni di ricarica
Supporto nella creazione di presentazioni per il Management




Cosa vorremmo trovare in te?

Problem solving, pensiero critico e analitico
Capacità di raccogliere e analizzare dati, feedback qualitativi e quantitativi per valutare il successo delle iniziative e dei progetti
Doti organizzative e di relazione con soggetti interni ed esterni all'azienda
Orientamento al cliente
Capacità di sviluppare presentazioni




Quali conosce ed esperienze vorremmo che avessi maturato in passato?

Ottima conoscenza di MS Office (in particolare Excel), richiesta prima esperienza in MS PowerBI
Prima esperienza con Salesforce
Competenze di programmazione (ad es. Python, Excel, SQL)
Inglese e italiano fluenti
Laurea o titolo superiore in ingegneria, informatica o economia




Cosa aspetti a candidarti? Non vediamo l'ora di conoscerti!




Prima di inviare la tua candidatura, ti preghiamo di prendere visione dell’informativa privacy disponibile al seguente link: https://ewiva.com/privacy-policy-area-lavora-con-noi/.




Cosa ti offriamo?

Lo stage avrà una durata di 6 mesi.

Sarà previsto un rimborso mensile, rimborso dei pasti e la possibilità di lavorare in smart working.

Show more

Title: Junior Data Analyst
Description:
Adecco Italia Spa, ricerca per azienda operante nel settore della produzione di energia elettrica da fonte rinnovabile e tradizionale, una risorsa da inserire nell'ambito dell’Energy Management.




Ruolo: Data Analyst Junior




Descrizione delle attività:

Analisi, raccoglimento e interpretazione dati;
Stretta collaborazione con responsabili dei diversi dipartimenti aziendali;
Elaborazione report dettagliati con i risultati delle osservazioni effettuate;
Individuazione soluzioni concrete a partire dai risultati delle analisi.




Requisiti:

Conoscenza linguaggio di programmazione R e gestionale Python;
Ottima conoscenza di Excel;
Eccellenti doti di analisi anche di documenti regolatori e normativi complessi e di sintesi;
Titolo preferenziale la conoscenza dei mercati energetici (gas e elettrico).







Completano il profilo:

Problem solving

Capacità di gestione dello stress




Sede di lavoro: Civitavecchia

Modalità di lavoro: in sede, si prevedono due turni.

Tipologia contratto: inserimento diretto in azienda, retribuzione da definire coerentemente con le competenze della persona.




I candidati, nel rispetto del D.lgs. 198/2006, D.lgs 215/2003 e D.lgs 216/2003, sono invitati a leggere l'informativa sulla privacy consultabile sotto il form di richiesta dati della pagina di candidatura (Regolamento UE n. 2016/679).




ATTENZIONE: Abbiamo rilevato la presenza in rete di molti annunci falsi; prendi visione dei nostri consigli per riconoscere i tentativi di truffa sulla pagina dedicata al phishing su adecco.it.

Adecco Italia S.p.A. (Aut. Min. Prot. N.1100-SG del 26.11.2004).

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Role Description

This is a part-time remote role for a Data Analyst at The Recruitment WPS. The Data Analyst will be responsible for analyzing data, creating data models, interpreting statistical information, and communicating insights to stakeholders.




Qualifications

Analytical Skills, Data Analytics, and Data Modeling abilities
Strong statistical knowledge
Effective Communication skills
Bachelor's degree in Statistics, Mathematics, Computer Science, or related field
Experience with data visualization tools
Attention to detail and problem-solving skills

Title: Data Analyst (H/F)
Description:
⚡️ La team recrute : toi aussi, deviens un InnovActeur ⚡️




Qui sommes-nous ? 🧐




En 2024, nous rassemblons l’ensemble de nos activités au sein d’AWAKE Group, pour accélérer les innovations environnementales et responsables dans l’industrie. 🌱




AWAKE Group, c’est :

d’un côté INNOVATEAM, acteur de référence du conseil en ingénierie
de l’autre AWAKE, notre expertise dédiée aux projets à forte valeur ajoutée environnementale et responsable, qui se déploie en Belgique et en France. 🇫🇷🇧🇪




En tant qu’ingénieurs, nous contribuons à façonner le monde en participant aux grandes avancées technologiques, en révolutionnant les secteurs suivants :




🚆Smart Mobility

☀️New Energies & Infrastructures

💻Connectivity & Data

🔬Healthcare

🌎Defence & Space




De cette responsabilité en découle une autre 👉 assumer à notre niveau l’impact du progrès sur notre planète et agir pour en limiter les effets indésirables.




AWAKE Group c’est une équipe jeune, dynamique et engagée ! Tes futurs collaborateurs sont super (la preuve : nous sommes accrédités HappyIndex@AtWork depuis 9 années consécutives !) 🤩




Nous sommes à la recherche d’un Data Analyst (H/F) chez un de nos partenaires en Belgique dans le secteur de l’Energie 🔎.




A propos du poste 🧐




Missions :




Nous recherchons un professionnel chargé de prendre en charge les traitements de données des applications, incluant le Data Warehousing, l'analyse et la modélisation de données, ainsi que la création de testeurs pour assurer la qualité des processus.




Vous aurez la responsabilité des tâches suivantes :

Prendre en charge les traitements de données des applications
Data Warehousing
Analyse des données
Modélisation de données
Créer des testeurs




Compétences :




Esprit d’équipe et communication
Bonne capacité d’écoute
Être force de proposition
Grande rigueur




Les petits + ✨

En nous rejoignant, tu gagnes plusieurs avantages :




🍃 Rejoindre une société qui compense entièrement ton empreinte carbone #Ingenieur&Citoyen

⚡️Bénéficier de 180 euros par an sur notre plateforme TeamStarter pour créer les afterworks et teambuildings de ton choix

😀 De la bonne humeur et de super events tout au long de l’année !

HTML:
⚡️ La team recrute : toi aussi, deviens un InnovActeur ⚡️


Qui sommes-nous ? 🧐


En 2024, nous rassemblons l’ensemble de nos activités au sein d’AWAKE Group, pour accélérer les innovations environnementales et responsables dans l’industrie. 🌱


AWAKE Group, c’est :

  • d’un côté INNOVATEAM, acteur de référence du conseil en ingénierie
  • de l’autre AWAKE, notre expertise dédiée aux projets à forte valeur ajoutée environnementale et responsable, qui se déploie en Belgique et en France. 🇫🇷🇧🇪


En tant qu’ingénieurs, nous contribuons à façonner le monde en participant aux grandes avancées technologiques, en révolutionnant les secteurs suivants :


🚆Smart Mobility

☀️New Energies & Infrastructures

💻Connectivity & Data

🔬Healthcare

🌎Defence & Space


De cette responsabilité en découle une autre 👉 assumer à notre niveau l’impact du progrès sur notre planète et agir pour en limiter les effets indésirables.


AWAKE Group c’est une équipe jeune, dynamique et engagée ! Tes futurs collaborateurs sont super (la preuve : nous sommes accrédités HappyIndex@AtWork depuis 9 années consécutives !) 🤩


Nous sommes à la recherche d’un Data Analyst (H/F) chez un de nos partenaires en Belgique dans le secteur de l’Energie 🔎.


A propos du poste 🧐


Missions :


Nous recherchons un professionnel chargé de prendre en charge les traitements de données des applications, incluant le Data Warehousing, l'analyse et la modélisation de données, ainsi que la création de testeurs pour assurer la qualité des processus.


Vous aurez la responsabilité des tâches suivantes :

  • Prendre en charge les traitements de données des applications
  • Data Warehousing
  • Analyse des données
  • Modélisation de données
  • Créer des testeurs


Compétences :


  • Esprit d’équipe et communication
  • Bonne capacité d’écoute
  • Être force de proposition
  • Grande rigueur


Les petits + ✨

En nous rejoignant, tu gagnes plusieurs avantages :


🍃 Rejoindre une société qui compense entièrement ton empreinte carbone #Ingenieur&Citoyen

⚡️Bénéficier de 180 euros par an sur notre plateforme TeamStarter pour créer les afterworks et teambuildings de ton choix

Title: Graduate Data Analyst - Lisbon
Description:
At Efficio, we're not just a consulting firm; we're a team of dedicated experts committed to transforming procurement and supply chain functions. Our mission is to drive sustainable, measurable value for our clients through innovative solutions and deep industry insights. Join us and be part of a dynamic environment where your skills and ideas make a real impact.

Efficio is the world’s largest specialist procurement and supply chain consultancy, with offices across Europe, North America, and the Middle East. We’re a diverse team of over 1,000 individuals, representing more than 60 different nationalities and speaking 40+ languages – and we’re continuing to grow rapidly!

Efficio is currently looking for Data Analysts to join their growing Digital Delivery team. The Digital business delivers a range of standard and bespoke technology products to our clients to complement our market-leading eFlow platform and procurement consulting services.

As a Data Analyst, you will:


Work with external and internal stakeholders to draw insights out of large data sets and implement technical solutions that enable this on an ongoing basis
Use SQL to load, transform and query data from a variety of sources
Produce well designed Tableau dashboards that are easy to use and allow users to draw actionable insight from their data
Explore and document business and technical requirements
Present outputs to internal and external stakeholders
Support delivery of technical training courses
Support our culture of continuous improvement by bringing innovative ideas, new technology and new processes to the team
Author clear, concise technical documentation


Our collaborative and inclusive culture is what makes us stand out. At Efficio, colleagues with diverse backgrounds, ideas, and viewpoints come together to identify innovative solutions for our clients - and so we're looking for our new team members to bring strong communication, empathy, and relationship-building skills to maintain this culture as we grow.

We'd love to hear about any additional skills or experiences you bring to the table. We're particularly interested in:


Fluency in a European language (Spanish, French, German, Italian), in addition to English
An exemplary academic background
A keen interest in working with data and data visualisation
Effective communication skills with the ability to influence stakeholders
Strong numerical, analytical, and problem-solving skills
Excellent attention to detail and motivation to suggest new ideas and see tasks through to completion
Working knowledge of SQL, preferably MS SQL
Hands-on experience with Tableau; similar experience with other visualisation technologies also good
Experience of a technology transformation project: from requirements gathering through to implementation. This can be from internal or consulting experience
Proficiency in the use of Excel and PowerPoint
Show more

Title: Business Data Analyst - Madrid
Description:
Engel & Völkers lleva más de 40 años en la intermediación de inmuebles residenciales y comerciales de alto standing, contando con unas 800 oficinas en 33 países y en 4 continentes. En España, tenemos una fuerte presencia desde el año 1990 y contamos en la actualidad con más de 80 tiendas.




En el Market Center de Madrid estamos buscando un Business Data Analyst, orientado a apoyar al equipo de operaciones para el crecimiento continuo de Engel & Völkers.




¿Cuáles serán tus responsabilidades?




Construir soluciones pragmáticas, escalables y estadísticamente rigurosas para los problemas y desafíos que podamos enfrentar, aprovechando o desarrollando metodologías estadísticas y de aprendizaje automático.
Responder preguntas generales enmarcando la pregunta, convirtiéndola en un plan analítico, ejecutándola y comunicándola a las partes interesadas.
Ser el punto de contacto y account manager de los diferentes portales inmobiliarios (Idealista, Fotocasa, Habitaclia y otros), así como tener un control diario de nuestros competidores, para trabajar de forma transversal y definir prioridades y/o soluciones.
Analizar en profundidad las métricas operativas y la metodología de Engel & Völkers, para comprender los patrones de comportamiento de nuestros clientes y agentes inmobiliarios, y las posibles áreas de mejora.
Crear, modificar y resolver problemas para garantizar la entrega de análisis e informes precisos y claros.
Proporcionar información para respaldar la toma de decisiones.
Como Business Data Analyst, necesitarás generar confianza con Team Leaders y Sales Directors de todas nuestras oficinas en Madrid.




Ofrecemos:




- Contrato indefinido y jornada completa.




- Horario: De lunes a viernes de 9 a 18h.




- Trabajo en una empresa líder en su sector y formar parte de un equipo de alto rendimiento.




- 22 días laborables de vacaciones y tu día de cumpleaños libre.




- Posibilidad de teletrabajo.




- Acceso al Plan de Retribución Flexible (Seguro médico, Tickets guardería y más)







REQUISITOS MÍNIMOS:




Licenciatura en un campo cuantitativo (Ciencias de la Computación, Ingeniería, Matemáticas, Estadística, Investigación de Operaciones u otro campo relacionado).
Conocimientos de paquete Office a nivel usuario y nivel de Excel y Google Sheet, preferiblemente avanzado. Valoraremos que tengas conocimientos en Data visualization y en otros software/plataformas estadísticas.
Experiencia iniciando e impulsando proyectos hasta su finalización.
Experiencia comunicando investigaciones complejas de manera clara, precisa y procesable.
Pensador crítico, innovador y solucionador de problemas.
Idiomas: inglés nivel medio.
Posibilidad de movilizarte a todas nuestras oficinas en Madrid.

Show more

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Founded in 2005 in Lisbon by three visionary entrepreneurs, MoOngy quickly became a leading group in Engineering and Information Technology (IT) across Europe and North Africa. Today, with a presence in 14 countries and more than 40 subsidiary companies, MoOngy employs over 9,500 talents who share a common passion for innovation and excellence.

The International Mobility Recruitment Department is dedicated to enhancing the mobility of IT professionals throughout Europe, facilitating the placement of talents in the various markets where it operates.




Position: Data Analyst

Location: Belgium

Type: Hybrid




Power Skills:

You are ready to work on global projects and contribute to digital transformation across various industries;
You wish to expand your career beyond national borders and you are ready for an European adventure;
You want to be part of a global community of innovators.




Technical and Soft Skills:




We are currently seeking a skilled and experienced Data Analyst with expertise in PowerBI, Python, and Data Bases (SQL). As a Data Analyst, you will be responsible for analyzing complex datasets, creating visualizations, and generating insights to support data-driven decision making within our organization. You will work closely with stakeholders from various departments to understand their data needs and provide them with relevant analysis and reports. The ideal candidate is detail-oriented, proficient in data manipulation and analysis, and has a strong understanding of database concepts and data visualization techniques.




Responsibilities

Conduct data analysis using various tools and techniques, including PowerBI, Python, and SQL
Develop and implement data models and databases to support data analysis and reporting
Collaborate with stakeholders to understand their data needs and provide them with timely and accurate analysis and reports
Identify trends and patterns in data and provide insights and recommendations based on analysis
Cleanse and transform data to ensure accuracy and consistency
Develop and maintain dashboards and reports to visualize and communicate data findings
Stay updated with the latest industry trends and advancements in data analysis and visualization techniques




Requirements

Bachelor's degree in a quantitative field such as Computer Science, Statistics, Mathematics, or Economics
Proven experience as a Data Analyst, preferably in a similar industry
Proficiency in PowerBI, Python, and SQL for data analysis and visualization
Strong knowledge of database concepts and ability to work with large datasets
Familiarity with data modeling and database design principles
Excellent analytical and problem-solving skills
Strong attention to detail and ability to work with minimal supervision
Excellent communication and interpersonal skills, with the ability to present complex ideas in a clear and concise manner
Fluent inEnglish is mandatory
Fluency in French (C2 level) or Dutch (C1 level) is mandatory
Candidates must be in Europe already




Advantages of joining MoOngy:

International Mobility: Access to a dedicated international mobility department with personalized relocation programs to facilitate your move to a new country.

Career Development: Opportunities to work on projects with cutting-edge technologies in different countries and various sectors.

Continuous Learning: Access to ongoing and free training and career-oriented certifications.

Personal Growth: Exchange of ideas and best practices among professionals across Europe, fostering creativity and innovation in IT.

Global Citizen in the World of Technology: Opportunity to work in a global network of companies, with access to a wide range of challenging projects in different European markets.




@MoOngy Group we stand for equality and value diversity. We create a safe, diverse environment where opportunities are equal for everyone! We do not discriminate based on age, ethnicity, sexual orientation, gender, disability, or any factor other than merit. All applications with skills needed for the position are welcome!

Title: Junior Data Analyst
Description:
Job Description




Managing the day-to-day customer engagement for all production clients, you will work closely with our Client Consultants in the UK and US offices to ensure that our client base is fully supported. As part of your role you will be expected to complete data acquisition, data validation, data load and report refreshes on a scheduled basis, identifying waste and suggest innovations to ensure all repeatable processes are automated.




Responsibilities




Data acquisition, regular data refreshes, user setup
Client support including responding to client support emails and calls
Diagnosing and fixing client issues
Client on-boarding and training
Manage and own client facing documentation, training and solution user guides
Working with clients to scope, build, and deploy AD-HOC requests
Additional client consultancy including face-to-face workshops and advanced training




Key competencies and Required Skills

Proven experience in client facing roles; working with and communicating to senior stakeholders and with multiple layers across the business and vendors
Analytical and numerate mind with an ability to standardise data from multiple sources and to identify potential anomalies
English advanced

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
At GemPool we are currently working with a dynamic startup based in Dublin, where innovation, learning, and growth drive their success. They are looking for a passionate and detail-oriented Data Engineer & Analyst to join their team. In this role, you will play a pivotal part in creating and analyzing large datasets, generating business intelligence reports, and delivering data-driven insights for their clients. If you thrive on curiosity, creativity, and independent thinking, this is the perfect opportunity to make a significant impact and grow with us.




Core Responsibilities:

Data Preparation & Transformation: Conduct thorough data cleaning, transformation, and integration across various datasets to maintain high data quality.
Advanced Excel Analysis: Leverage advanced Excel techniques, including pivot tables, lookups, and complex formulas, to analyze and interpret large datasets.
Data Reconciliation: Perform data reconciliation and validation to identify and resolve discrepancies, ensuring consistency and accuracy.
Automation with Python & SQL: Utilize Python and SQL to streamline data processes, execute complex queries, and derive meaningful insights from extensive datasets.
Data Enrichment: Enhance existing datasets by extracting and integrating data from online sources and APIs, keeping information up-to-date and comprehensive.
Insightful Reporting: Create detailed reports and dashboards using business intelligence tools, translating data into actionable insights for clients and internal stakeholders.




Required Skills:

Proficient in Excel: Strong expertise in advanced Excel functions and tools for in-depth data analysis and reporting.
Python & SQL Expertise: Solid experience in using Python (with libraries like pandas and NumPy) and SQL for data manipulation and automation.
Data Quality Management: Proven ability in data cleaning, matching, and transformation to ensure high data integrity.
Data Extraction Skills: Knowledge of data scraping methods and tools for enriching and expanding datasets.
Experience with BI Tools: Familiarity with business intelligence platforms like AWS Quicksight, Tableau, or Power BI for creating impactful reports and visualizations.
Analytical & Innovative: Strong analytical abilities, with a creative mindset and a keen eye for detail, paired with a passion for discovering insights from data.

Title: Analista de datos
Company: Voiping US, somos Talento TIC ¡Crecemos Juntos!
Description:
¡En Voiping US seleccionamos Talento!




Desde el Departamento de Talento & Recruitment de Voiping US, seleccionamos un Junior Data Analytics para incorporarse en el equipo de uno de nuestros clientes más importantes y reconocido dentro del sector IT.




¿Crees que es el momento de seguir creciendo profesionalmente? Esta oportunidad es para ti, estamos buscando profesionales con nuevos objetivos, con ganas de trabajar y con mucha pasión para formar parte de un gran equipo de trabajo.




Requisitos:

Experiencia con rendimiento de Bases de Datos SQL (Oracle, DB2, DB2 Host) y NoSQL (MongoDB, ElasticSearch).
La revisión se llevará a cabo de forma manual, por lo que es imprescindible el dominio de la herramienta Power Designer o alguna otra herramienta de modelado de datos equivalente.




Condiciones:

60% remoto
Contrato indefinido




Si cuentas con los requisitos necesarios y te interesa un nuevo proyecto, ¡inscríbete! y contactaremos posteriormente a la mayor brevedad posible y te comentaremos más detalles de nuestra propuesta.




Si te interesa escuchar nuestra propuesta, puedes enviar tu CV actualizado a: msanchis@voiping.es




Muchas gracias.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
About the Company:




Penta Consulting are a technology service provider and leading outsourced partner helping to deliver professional and managed solutions across Poland.




About the Role:




We are supporting a well esteemed client of ours searching for a Sales Support who will be working a remote position based in Poland. The successful Sales support will be expected to start as soon as possible.




Job Role:




Reading, Writing and Responding in German
To support the customer, partner and Cisco Sales Team while ensuring seamless operations of the Frame Contracts.
You will be working with established Cisco tools like CCW, SFDC etc. dedicated IT tools.




Skills Needed:

German language (spoken and written)
Problem solving mindset
Strong communication skills with internal and external stakeholders
Eager to learn and adapt in a non-standard changing environment
Advanced Microsoft Excel
Preferably experience in working with Cisco tools for sales operations and deal support (especially CCW, SFDC, ..)
Eager to learn and adapt in a non-standard changing environment
If this sounds like a good opportunity for you, please apply and we will be in touch!
Qualifications




Please don't hesitate to apply or contact me at Mattwhite@pentaconsulting.com

Make sure to send me your most up to date CV.

About the Company:


Penta Consulting are a technology service provider and leading outsourced partner helping to deliver professional and managed solutions across Poland.


About the Role:


We are supporting a well esteemed client of ours searching for a Sales Support who will be working a remote position based in Poland. The successful Sales support will be expected to start as soon as possible.


Job Role:


  • Reading, Writing and Responding in German
  • To support the customer, partner and Cisco Sales Team while ensuring seamless operations of the Frame Contracts.
  • You will be working with established Cisco tools like CCW, SFDC etc. dedicated IT tools.


Skills Needed:

  • German language (spoken and written)
  • Problem solving mindset
  • Strong communication skills with internal and external stakeholders
  • Eager to learn and adapt in a non-standard changing environment
  • Advanced Microsoft Excel
  • Preferably experience in working with Cisco tools for sales operations and deal support (especially CCW, SFDC, ..)
  • Eager to learn and adapt in a non-standard changing environment
  • If this sounds like a good opportunity for you, please apply and we will be in touch!
  • Qualifications


Please don't hesitate to apply or contact me at Mattwhite@pentaconsulting.com

Make sure to send me your most up to date CV.

Title: Junior Data Analyst
Description:
About the Company: Allegis Group is the fourth largest staffing company in the world and consists of several specialist operating companies. We have over 23,000 employees, located within 400 offices globally. Our experience and expertise allow us to build strong relationships with clients who value our involvement in solving their challenges.




About the Role: The Front Office Technology Team's primary duty is to support the region (through technology) to achieve its revenue goals. The team does this by innovating on behalf of our sales customers; through process efficiencies; identifying trends and adjusting our approach; managing third-party relationships, and by showing the business what good looks like and what is possible. Our Information Services teams are responsible for all core enterprise technologies such as Outlook, allowing the Front Office Technology Team to focus on revenue growth activities.




Responsibilities:

Supporting strategic initiatives, projects and implementations delivered by the Front Office Technology team.
Take an active role in partnering and managing third-party supplier relationships across Europe. This will include negotiating commercials, identifying training needs and provisioning of accounts.
Troubleshooting issues and problems across those technologies which Front Office Technology manage.
Support the build and maintenance of activity dashboards, along with activity trends analysis.
Partner with Sales leaders and other stakeholders to identify process improvements in line with the business priorities.
Support and manage ad-hoc projects.
Proactively streamline and automate existing processes and act as the first point of contact for core workstreams.




Qualifications:

Bachelor's Degree preferred




Required Skills:

Natural team player

Customer-focused, helpful and willing to support at all times

Advanced Microsoft Office skills (Word, PowerPoint, Excel)

Passionate about using and manipulating data to solve business challenges

Strong communication skills

Ability to work under pressure, manage high workloads whilst maintaining the ability to organise and prioritise

Flexible style to accommodate shifting business priorities

Excellent attention to detail and accuracy

Previous working experience within CRM tools, ideally Salesforce

Build relationships and provide ongoing coaching to individual users and the Professional Development team for core suppliers

Problem-solving and root cause identification skills

Have in-depth knowledge of the Recruitment industry, services and products, along with their application.

Knowledge of the I.T. Services and/or Staffing Industry

Experience leveraging technology to enhance a Sales workforce's productivity

Experience in B.I./Data Analytics

Strong problem solving and analytical skills

Strong decision-making ability

Proven track record in training and coaching

Recognised subject matter expert in CV database and job posting technology, with a strong knowledge of how a recruiter should Source effectively using these channels




Preferred Skills:

Ability to build/maintain relationships at all levels

Flexible and adaptable; able to work in ambiguous situations

Creative approach to solving business challenges.

Positive influence on those around you

Open to feedback

Takes responsibility and is accountable for own performance

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
· Experience:

5+ experience as a Data Analyst with a strong focus on SQL and data analysis.
Practical experience with PySpark or other big data processing frameworks is highly desirable.

· Technical Skills:

Proficient in SQL, with a strong understanding of database management and optimization.
Experience with PySpark, including writing Spark jobs and working with large datasets.
Familiarity with Python for statistical analysis and data manipulation is a plus.

· Soft Skills:

Strong analytical and problem-solving abilities.
Excellent communication skills, with the ability to present complex data insights clearly.
Detail-oriented with a commitment to accuracy and quality.

Title: Data Analyst - Saudi Arabia
Description:
Make an impact by working for sectors where technology is the enabler, everything is ground-breaking and there’s a constant need to be innovative.

Be part of the team that combines business knowledge, technological edge and a design experience. Our different backgrounds and know-how are key in developing solutions and experiences for digital clients.

Face challenges and learn other ways of thinking and seeing the world - there’s always room for your energy and creativity.

About The Role

Data Analyst is responsible for examining and interpreting complex data sets to derive meaningful insights and support business decision-making. Focused on descriptive and diagnostic analytics to answer questions of where your company has been, where it is now, why things are the way they are now, and support the decision about what are the next steps.

Their mission involves organizing data, conducting statistical analysis, creating data models, and collecting data requirements from Businesses.

Data analysts collaborate with different teams to understand their analytical requirements, identify key metrics, and communicate data-driven findings to stakeholders effectively.

As a part of your job, you will:


Gathering and analyzing business requirements to determine the best solution for data reporting and analysis.
Designing data solutions such as data warehousing, data marts, dashboards, and reporting systems.
Developing and maintaining data models, reports, and visualizations.
Collaborating with IT teams to ensure proper data integration and management.
Assisting stakeholders in interpreting data insights and making informed business decisions.



What are we looking for?


Proficiency in SQL for data querying and analysis;
Experience with data visualization tools (e.g., Tableau, Power BI, or Matplotlib);
Knowledge of statistical analysis techniques and tools (e.g., R, Python libraries like pandas);
Ability to interpret and analyze complex data sets;
Familiarity with data cleansing and preparation techniques.



Personal traits:

Ability to adapt to different contexts, teams and Clients

Teamwork skills but also sense of autonomy

Motivation for international projects and ok if travel is included

Willingness to collaborate with other players

Strong communication skills

We want people who like to roll up their sleeves and open their minds. Believe this is you? Come join the Team!

Celfocus is a European high-tech system integrator, providing professional services focused on creating business value through Analytics and Cognitive solutions – addressing Telecommunications, Energy & Utilities, Financial Services and other markets' strategic opportunities.

Serving Clients in 25+ countries, Celfocus delivers solutions such as accelerating digital network transformation in Autonomous Networks, elevating and monetising business services in B2B2x ecosystems, and providing highly relevant customer experiences through Hyper-personalisation solutions.
Show more

Title: Analista de datos
Description:
¿Eres un apasionado del análisis de datos y buscas una oportunidad para aplicar tus habilidades en una empresa dinámica y en crecimiento? ¡Te estamos buscando!

Estamos buscando un Analista de Datos con al menos dos años de experiencia para unirse a nuestro equipo. Si tienes un título universitario o un grado superior técnico y experiencia en Power BI, queremos saber de ti.




Responsabilidades:

Analizar grandes conjuntos de datos para identificar tendencias, patrones y oportunidades.
Desarrollar y mantener informes y dashboards utilizando Power BI.
Diseño y transformaciones de datos (ETL-ELT)
Definición de indicadores y métricas con diferentes departamentos para entender sus necesidades de datos y proporcionar soluciones analíticas.
Interpretar los resultados del análisis de datos y comunicar hallazgos a stakeholders de manera clara y concisa.
Participar en la mejora continua de procesos de análisis de datos y metodología.




Requisitos Clave (H/M/D):

Al menos dos años de experiencia como Analista de Datos o en un rol similar.
Título universitario o grado superior técnico en un campo relacionado (por ejemplo, Estadística, Matemáticas, Ingeniería, Informática).
Experiencia demostrable en el uso de Power BI para la creación de informes y dashboards.
Capacidad analítica y atención al detalle.
Excelentes habilidades de comunicación verbal y escrita.




Requisitos Deseables:

Experiencia con Modelado de datos
Conocimiento en SQL para consultas y manipulación de datos.
Conocimiento en otros lenguajes de programación y herramientas de análisis de datos
Experiencia en la manipulación de datos en grandes bases de datos.




Beneficios:

Salario competitivo y paquete de beneficios.
Oportunidades de desarrollo profesional y formación continua.
Flexibilidad horaria y modalidad de trabajo hibrido
Programas de bienestar y actividades recreativas.

Show more

Title: Data Analyst - Corporate Reporting
Description:
Nature and aim of the position

You have a strong product instinct and eagerness for data-centric analytical products? You are passionate about data and interested to see how Business Intelligence (BI) solutions are used in digital transaction environments such as tax free shopping business?

If you are a business-oriented person with curiosity for data and sharp attention to details, then we are looking for someone just like you to join our Data & Business Intelligence team in and help us with implementing best in class approach for Corporate reporting and analysis in order to protect Global Blue Valuable asset while enabling efficient innovation long term.

Reporting to the BI Corporate Reporting Manager and within the Data & Analytics Unit of Value, you will be participating to the create reports to be used at Corporate level and to define key KPI for Corporate strategies and activities.




Main duties and responsibilities




Support the production of bespoke Corporate reports
Executing business analysis for internal stakeholders leveraging Global / corporate best practices
Analyse & Support internal users requests for data and analytics to be deployed into BI solutions platform
Identify opportunities to improve production efficiency and contribute to the development of business strategy




Background and Education




A Bachelor's degree, preferably in Analytics, Statistics or Economics
3-5 years of working experience as a data / Business analyst in charge of developing and producing performance reports for internal / external clients
Proven ability to manage, transform and extract large volumes of data
Attention to detail and curious to understand how business performance is structured across different drivers
Advanced knowledge of analytic tools (Tableau and / or Micro Strategy are a plus)
Intermediate knowledge of Microsoft SQL for data extraction and manipulation is a plus
Basic knowledge of data science tools like R / Python is a plus
Advanced mastery of Office tools especially Excel
Fluency in English is a must

Specific skills and knowledge

Attention to details to deliver against senior management stakeholders expectations
Solid communication skills demonstrated
Experience in working with dislocated teams in a global, multicultural environment
Experience in handling demanding stakeholders from different technical/business areas and tight timelines
You have a strong curiosity to find out how products and systems work and are inquisitive and proactive
Ability to work independently

Additional comments: Agile working model - 2 days / week in office

Title: Data Analyst
Place: Copenhagen, Capital Region of Denmark, Denmark
Description:
A little about us...

LTIMindtree is a global technology consulting and digital solutions company that enables enterprises across industries to reimagine business models, accelerate innovation, and maximize growth by harnessing digital technologies. As a digital transformation partner to more than 750 clients, LTIMindtree brings extensive domain and technology expertise to help drive superior competitive differentiation, customer experiences, and business outcomes in a converging world.

· We provide our employees with a learning environment that promotes growth and creativity.

· To learn more please visit us at https://www.ltimindtree.com/Twitter @ https://twitter.com/ltimindtre




We are looking for Data Analyst with below expertise:




Work as an IT analyst Designer , Data Modeler and Data Analyst
Minimum 10 years of experience
Strong in SQL
Understanding business requirements and converting them to IT requirements
Participating conducting meetings with business BA or framework SME to capture requirements
Performing data and object level analysis for identifying IT solution More
Ability to write SQL Queries back track data
Description of knowledge and experience
Previous experience of banking and financial regulatory framework data models would be a huge plus
Experience of data analysis and modelling
Hands on experience of advanced SQL for query execution
Experience of Scrum Agile methodologies
Ability to understand data warehouse architecture
Ability to understand business requirements and translate them into technical design for development
Ability to understand data models from both business and technical perspective Logic Physical Symantec Layer
Ability to understand technology and technical perspectives RDMS Teradata Snowflake
Understanding of regulatory frameworks such as FINREP COREP etc
Experience and knowledge of financial regulatory reporting and data attributes
Ability to communicate effectively with both business stakeholders and IT experts
Supporting testers in root cause analysis of incidents

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
At S[&]T we contribute to a safer life on Earth by translating space data into valuable and actionable insights. With this, we help organizations, governments and commercial entities to strengthen their information position and thereby improve their decision-making. We focus on 4 domains: Space & Science, Defence & Security, Environment & Sustainability and the High-Tech Industry. We control all levels of the data value chain from data source to user applications, and apply our expertise within our innovations, customer projects and talent acquisition services. Our headquarters are in Delft, The Netherlands and we have two satellite offices in Oslo, Norway, and Rome, Italy with a total of 125 experts employed at S[&]T.




We are currently looking for a Data Analyst to join the team in Delft.




As a Data Analyst, you analyze and interpret raw spectra data and convert it into useful information.




Responsibilities:

You will collect, check, and structure data.
You will design data processing algorithms that process obtained spectra into accurate material properties, such as elemental mass percentages.
You will create data models.
You will draw up reports and presentations.
You will provide advice on the information obtained, such as material sampling strategy, measurement strategy, or measurement setup improvements.
You will participate in project teams.




Requirements:

You have a Master’s Degree in Mathematics, Physics, or Computer Science.
You have experience in collecting, processing, and analysing data, preferably in a high-tech environment.
You have strong communication skills.
You have a broad knowledge of Python, programming languages, and analysis methods, such as statistical analysis, least-squares regression and curve-fitting, and machine learning.
You have the ability to explain complex information in an understandable way.
You have theoretical and practical knowledge of data modelling and semantics.




Interested? Then click to apply or send your CV and motivational letter to recruitment@stcorp.nl.




Privacy Notice: In order to apply for this vacancy you must submit your personal information to Science [&] Technology. Science [&] Technology will collect, use, and process your personal information as mentioned in our Privacy Policy. Our policy and processing of your personal information are compliant with the GDPR.




Please note that if you do not hear back from us within 10 days of your application, you may assume that we have selected another candidate we would like to interview for this position. We do our best to get back to you individually, however, due to a high volume of responses, we might not have been able to reject your application in person.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Do you want to change the world? At Cabify, that’s what we’re doing. We aim to make cities better places to live by improving mobility for the people living in them, connecting riders to drivers at the touch of a button. Maybe one day cities will be places where nobody needs a private car. But we’ve still got a long way to go...fancy joining us?

About The Position

As a Data Analyst, you'll be part of an exceptional team of over 30 SQL and data visualization specialists. Our Data Analytics department is organized around 11 problem spaces that mirror the structure of the entire company, ensuring that every decision we make at Cabify is data-driven.

In your day-to-day role, you'll work in a multidisciplinary squad with other disciplines such as Product, Engineering, Growth, and Operations. We also follow agile methodologies within each analytics group and foster an environment of knowledge and resource sharing among the department.

If you're passionate about managing large volumes of data, you'll be delighted to know we leverage two different data warehouses, Google BigQuery and Amazon Redshift, to perform intensive analysis thus maximizing operational efficiency.

We take pride in working with one of the largest Tableau Server platforms in Europe, where we share not only powerful analysis and visualizations but also Self Service Data Sources, making data accessible to the entire company.

You Will

Work in technical data projects autonomously to enhance the company's analytics capabilities through functions such as:


Exploit large-scale data warehouses performing efficient SQL.
Define ETL models in our datawarehouse with Airflow.
Document and maintain your code and queries in Gitlab.
Create dashboards and reports using Tableau / PowerBI to communicate results and monitor KPIs regularly.
Execute exploratory analysis to shape future projects and provide action recommendations.
Present findings to squad team members to guide business and product decisions.
Work closely with engineers to define what data is needed for analysis, request creation of new app events, 3rd party integrations, collaborate in the data models design, granularity, and how they relate to existing models.
Help design new features alongside product managers and engineers, measuring their performance and testing their business impact.
Develop Data Sources to use across the organization, thus empowering business by exploring data in a trusted environment.


Our Ideal Candidate Has


Great alignment with our principles, we take this very seriously.
At least 1-2 years of working experience as a Data Analyst
Experienced in writing and understanding complex SQL and working with large data sets
Working knowledge of Tableau, Qlik, PowerBI, Looker, or any other data visualization tool
Graduate degree in Business Administration, Economics, Engineering, Statistics, or related fields
Fluency in English and Spanish


Bonus Points


A Master's degree in Business Analytics, Business Intelligence, or related
Product Analytics experience with Amplitude, Datadog, Mixpanel, or similar


What’s it like to work at Cabify?

We’re a Company Full Of Happy, Motivated People And We Never Want That To Change. Here Are Some More Reasons Why It Rocks To Be Part Of Our High-performance Team

⌚Hybrid Model (2 work-from-home days per week plus 6 weeks per year)

💶Excellent Salary conditions: L2 [30-40K€]

🏝️Recharge days

🌍Our office is located in Madrid.

⌚Flexible work environment & hours.

🙌Regular team events.

🚗Cabify staff free rides.

🚀Personal development programs based on our career paths.

🧘‍♀️ iFeel: Free access to the iFeel platform, so you can take care of your emotional well-being through therapy sessions.

📐Coursera: your own license in Coursera to take as many courses as you wish and continue developing your skills.

💳Flexible compensation plan: Restaurant tickets, transport tickets, healthcare and childcare

💻All the equipment you need (you only have to bring your talent).

🐱A pet room, so you don’t have to leave your furry friend at home

☕️And last but not least...free coffee and fruit!

Cabify is proud of being an equal-opportunity workplace. We celebrate diversity and are committed to creating an inclusive environment for all employees regardless of background, gender, religion, orientation, age, or ability.

Join us!
Show more
HTML:
Do you want to change the world? At Cabify, that’s what we’re doing. We aim to make cities better places to live by improving mobility for the people living in them, connecting riders to drivers at the touch of a button. Maybe one day cities will be places where nobody needs a private car. But we’ve still got a long way to go...fancy joining us?

About The Position

As a Data Analyst, you'll be part of an exceptional team of over 30 SQL and data visualization specialists. Our Data Analytics department is organized around 11 problem spaces that mirror the structure of the entire company, ensuring that every decision we make at Cabify is data-driven.

In your day-to-day role, you'll work in a multidisciplinary squad with other disciplines such as Product, Engineering, Growth, and Operations. We also follow agile methodologies within each analytics group and foster an environment of knowledge and resource sharing among the department.

If you're passionate about managing large volumes of data, you'll be delighted to know we leverage two different data warehouses, Google BigQuery and Amazon Redshift, to perform intensive analysis thus maximizing operational efficiency.

We take pride in working with one of the largest Tableau Server platforms in Europe, where we share not only powerful analysis and visualizations but also Self Service Data Sources, making data accessible to the entire company.

You Will

Work in technical data projects autonomously to enhance the company's analytics capabilities through functions such as:

  • Exploit large-scale data warehouses performing efficient SQL.
  • Define ETL models in our datawarehouse with Airflow.
  • Document and maintain your code and queries in Gitlab.
  • Create dashboards and reports using Tableau / PowerBI to communicate results and monitor KPIs regularly.
  • Execute exploratory analysis to shape future projects and provide action recommendations.
  • Present findings to squad team members to guide business and product decisions.
  • Work closely with engineers to define what data is needed for analysis, request creation of new app events, 3rd party integrations, collaborate in the data models design, granularity, and how they relate to existing models.
  • Help design new features alongside product managers and engineers, measuring their performance and testing their business impact.
  • Develop Data Sources to use across the organization, thus empowering business by exploring data in a trusted environment.

Our Ideal Candidate Has

  • Great alignment with our principles, we take this very seriously.
  • At least 1-2 years of working experience as a Data Analyst
  • Experienced in writing and understanding complex SQL and working with large data sets
  • Working knowledge of Tableau, Qlik, PowerBI, Looker, or any other data visualization tool
  • Graduate degree in Business Administration, Economics, Engineering, Statistics, or related fields
  • Fluency in English and Spanish

Bonus Points

  • A Master's degree in Business Analytics, Business Intelligence, or related
  • Product Analytics experience with Amplitude, Datadog, Mixpanel, or similar

What’s it like to work at Cabify?

We’re a Company Full Of Happy, Motivated People And We Never Want That To Change. Here Are Some More Reasons Why It Rocks To Be Part Of Our High-performance Team

⌚Hybrid Model (2 work-from-home days per week plus 6 weeks per year)

💶Excellent Salary conditions: L2 [30-40K€]

🏝️Recharge days

🌍Our office is located in Madrid.

⌚Flexible work environment & hours.

🙌Regular team events.

🚗Cabify staff free rides.

🚀Personal development programs based on our career paths.

🧘‍♀️ iFeel: Free access to the iFeel platform, so you can take care of your emotional well-being through therapy sessions.

📐Coursera: your own license in Coursera to take as many courses as you wish and continue developing your skills.

💳Flexible compensation plan: Restaurant tickets, transport tickets, healthcare and childcare

💻All the equipment you need (you only have to bring your talent).

🐱A pet room, so you don’t have to leave your furry friend at home

☕️And last but not least...free coffee and fruit!

Cabify is proud of being an equal-opportunity workplace. We celebrate diversity and are committed to creating an inclusive environment for all employees regardless of background, gender, religion, orientation, age, or ability.

Join us!

Title: HR Data Analyst
Description:
Siamo il Gruppo Lottomatica, leader nel settore del gioco regolamentato in Italia e uno dei maggiori operatori europei, in tutte le aree di attività: scommesse sportive, gioco online e macchine da intrattenimento. Offriamo ai nostri clienti esperienze di gioco sicure e di qualità, attraverso tutti i canali, ponendo la responsabilità e la sostenibilità al centro del business. Essere in Lottomatica è molto più che far parte di un'azienda: significa contribuire a un progetto imprenditoriale grande e responsabile.




Siamo alla ricerca, per una Società del Gruppo, di un profilo di HR Data Analyst, che entrerà a far parte del Dipartimento Human Resources & Organization.




Principali attività:

Elaborazione periodica degli analytics HR consolidati (per tutte le entità legali del Gruppo)
Gestione end-to-end delle attività di reporting e controlling: dalla raccolta dati all’analisi dei trend
Predisposizione del Budget HR e del costo del personale, e relative analisi di scostamento
Monitoraggio dei KPI HR in coordinamento con le Direzioni (es. monitoraggio ferie, attrition)
Presentazione dei dati analizzati
Garantire standard per data quality e consistency
Supporto ai progetti di HRIS




Requisiti:

Laurea Magistrale, preferibilmente in materie STEM
Un Master in risorse umane sarà considerato un plus
Richiesta pregressa esperienza di 3 anni in posizioni analoghe in Società di Consulenza o in società complesse
Conoscenza base di gestionali HR (Workday e Zucchetti saranno considerati un plus)
Conoscenza avanzata di Excel e Powerpoint
Inglese livello minimo B2
Ottime capacità analitiche
Precisione ed accuratezza
Riservatezza ed affidabilità




Cosa troverai in Lottomatica:

Opportunità di lavorare nella più grande azienda di scommesse e giochi in Italia e una delle più grandi al mondo;
Lavorare in un ambiente molto dinamico e migliorare le proprie competenze acquisendone di nuove;
Essere sfidati a fornire soluzioni d'impatto per grandi organizzazioni e avere un impatto diretto sui loro dipendenti;
Possibilità di partecipare a progetti di beneficenza, legalità e responsabilità attraverso l'impegno in Fondazione Lottomatica;
Un modello di DNA aziendale definito in cui Inclusione, Valore della Diversità, Eccellenza e Collaborazione sono i pilastri;
Far parte dell'azienda numero uno al mondo nel settore per impegno ESG;
Eccellenti opportunità di crescita.




Cosa offriamo:

Contratto a tempo indeterminato e opportunità di lavoro ibrido;
Ticket restaurant;
Formazione continua su hard skills e soft skills;
Stipendio annuo lordo commisurato all'esperienza (da 32k a 40k)
Job Grade: 2




Lottomatica attua una politica che garantisce pari opportunità e promuove diversità e inclusione, contro ogni forma di discriminazione.

In Lottomatica crediamo che ogni persona sia unica e consideriamo la diversity come una fonte di arricchimento personale e organizzativo.

Ci impegniamo ogni giorno affinchè il nostro sia un ambiente aperto, sicuro e inclusivo, dove ogni persona possa essere pienamente se stessa indipendentemente da genere, religione, sesso, età, etnia, nazionalità, disabilità, stato civile o orientamento sessuale.




*****




We are the Lottomatica Group, leader in regulated gaming in Italy and one of the largest European operators, in all areas of activity: sports betting, online gaming and amusement machines. We offer our customers safe and quality gaming experiences, through all channels, putting responsibility and sustainability at the core of the business. Being in Lottomatica is much more than being part of a company: it means contributing to a great and responsible entrepreneurial project.




We are looking for a HR Data Analyst profile for a Group Company, who will join the Human Resources & Organization Department.




Main activities:




Periodic processing of consolidated HR analytics (for all legal entities of the Group)
End-to-end management of reporting and controlling activities: from data collection to trend analysis
Preparation of HR and personnel cost budgets and related variance analyses
Monitoring of HR KPIs in coordination with Management (e.g. holiday monitoring, attrition)
Presentation of analysed data
Ensuring standards for data quality and consistency
Supporting HRIS projects




Requirements:

Master's degree, preferably in STEM subjects
A Master's degree in Human Resources will be considered a plus
Previous experience of 3 years in similar positions in Consultancy or complex companies required
Basic knowledge of HR management software (Workday and Zucchetti will be considered a plus)
Advanced knowledge of Excel and Powerpoint
English level at least B2
Excellent analytical skills
Accuracy and precision
Confidentiality and reliability




What you will find in Lottomatica

Opportunity to work in the largest betting and gaming company in Italy and one of the largest in the world;
Work in a very dynamic environment and improve your skills while acquiring new ones;
Being challenged to provide impactful solutions for large organisations and have a direct impact on their employees;
Opportunity to participate in charity, legality and responsibility projects through engagement in Fondazione Lottomatica;
A defined corporate DNA model in which Inclusion, Value of Diversity, Excellence and Collaboration are the pillars;
Being part of the world's number one company in the industry for ESG commitment;
Excellent growth opportunities.




What we offer:

Permanent contract and hybrid job opportunities;
Ticket restaurant;
Ongoing training on hard skills and soft skills;
Gross annual salary commensurate with experience (32k to 40k)
Job Grade: 2




Lottomatica implements a policy that guarantees equal opportunities and promotes diversity and inclusion, against all forms of discrimination.




At Lottomatica we believe that each person is unique and we consider diversity as a source of personal and organizational enrichment.




We strive every day for ours to be an open, safe and inclusive environment, where each person can be fully himself or herself regardless of gender, religion, sex, age, ethnicity, nationality, disability, marital status or sexual orientation.

Show more
